deity_entry.name: Abhoth
deity_entry.description_quote: A pool of gray stinking foulness, quivering and swelling in disjointed rhythm, and at its edges was a tide of obscene offal. Bubbles formed, creating and releasing its abominable spawn...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Abhoth appears to be imprisoned in the gray-litten cavern of Y'quaa, a black grotto, possibly within the subterranean realm of N'kai. Obscene monsters constantly form in the gray mass and crawl away from their parent. Abhoth creates pseudopods and limbs at will, using these to grasp countless numbers of its offspring so it may devour them.

cult.text: Abhoth has no organized human worshipers, although individuals may become obsessed with the entity. Some are compelled to gorge themselves on food, becoming morbidly obese. Distorted telepathic contact may cause a creative spurt in some humans, causing them to fashion 'art' from clay, paint, or extreme body modification.

possible_blessings.name: Artistic Obsession
possible_blessings.description: Creation of art in single or varied forms, each attempting to realize the deity's form or message.

possible_blessings.name: Manipulation of Life
possible_blessings.description: Granted some small portion of Abhoth, a cultist may use it to give strange life to a creation of clay, wood, metal, etc.

deity_entry.encounters: Those who come upon Abhoth may find the entity puts forth a probing hand or member to feel over the intruder. Depending on their intentions, Abhoth may treat with them or eat them.
deity_entry.aura: A sense of grime, filth, and foreboding. A feeling that 'things' are crawling over one's skin, and a general nausea.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Duplication
powers.description: May grant a small portion of its body mass to someone, which can then be grown into a spawn of Abhoth.

powers.name: Telepathy
powers.description: Able to communicate with its own spawn over any distance, and also with humans. Nearby humans may be coerced into performing Abhoth's will if they fail an Extreme POW roll.

combat.description: May create pseudopods to whip and strike, or to seize opponents. It may also throw up its bulk and smash down to crush.

special_maneuvers.name: Seize
special_maneuvers.description: Seizes and then absorbs the target on following round (killing them instantly). Those seized have one chance to escape by breaking or wriggling free with an Extreme STR or a Hard DEX roll.

special_maneuvers.name: Crush
special_maneuvers.description: Targets any group within 5 yards/meters, all of whom may attempt a Dodge roll to avoid being crushed for 6D6 damage.

armor.notes: Regenerates 20 hit points per round (death at zero hit points). If reduced to zero, sinks far into the earth and oozes back in 6D10 days.

deity_entry.name: Aforgomon
deity_entry.description_quote: As like a ray or beam of crackling energy does Aforgomon appear, reaching from the angles of time to penetrate the barriers of our world.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: A strange and rarely encountered avatar of Yog-Sothoth, Aforgomon appears to be concerned with time rather than space. The Book of Eibon tells that this entity appears only to those who have angered Yog-Sothoth by meddling with time.

cult.text: While there seems little in the way of organized worship on Earth, inhabitants of other dimensions pay particular devotion to Aforgomon. A handful of witches and wizards have sought to call upon this avatar to change past events or divine futures.

possible_blessings.name: Perceive Time
possible_blessings.description: Awards followers with glimpses of matters past or future.

possible_blessings.name: Time Travel
possible_blessings.description: A limited form of travel through time, allowing a cultist to travel back or forward at a cost 1 magic point per month moved.

deity_entry.encounters: Those caught in or meddling with time (such as casting spells such as Time Gate) may encounter Aforgomon.
deity_entry.aura: The ever-changing quality of time pervades all things touched by Aforgomon. The environment may rapidly alter, causing a room's furnishings to appear new one moment and decrepit the next.

magic.spells: Augury, Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Fist of Yog-Sothoth; others dealing with time.

powers.name: Chain of Aforgomon
powers.description: Those who have angered Aforgomon may be transported to the Dreamlands, chained naked to a huge stone chair suspended over a gaping abyss. The chains heat to incandescence, charring the body.

powers.name: Manipulate Time
powers.description: Ability to halt and otherwise manipulate time in its proximity (up to 10 miles/16 km).

powers.name: Time Travel
powers.description: May pass into and out of time at will.

combat.description: Uses its powers to affect and disorientate targets, or may issue a bolt of strange fire to damage and kill.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons (incl. bullets); mundane weapons have a 50 percent chance of disintegrating upon contact. Undying.

deity_entry.name: Ahtu
deity_entry.description_quote: A huge and twisting bundle of column of creased flesh, somewhat red-black in color. Around its upper portion extended a ring of snaking tentacles... It possessed no head and, instead, a bulbous, spherical eye of burning red and yellow formed at the summit.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Ahtu does not make frequent visits to the Earth. It is believed to have appeared in Asia, Africa, and possibly Australia, where it is said it rose up from deep below the ground, causing earth tremors and much consternation.

cult.text: Cults are said to undergo a horrendous initiation that leaves their bodies mutilated with amputated limbs and deep scars. Marks apparently emulate the wounds Ahtu inflicts.

deity_entry.encounters: Small groups of isolated peoples hold ceremonies and rituals of appeasement.
deity_entry.aura: Not detailed specifically, but associated with earth tremors and heat.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Earth Tremor
powers.description: When appearing, Ahtu rises from the ground, causing earth tremors in the region of level 5 on the Richter Scale. Those within 10 yards are assaulted with searing heat (6D6 damage) and chunks of rock (3D6 damage).

combat.description: May strike out with its eight tentacles (each with a range of 200 feet/61 m) or may use its massive bulk to crush once every four rounds.

armor.notes: If reduced to zero hit points, dissolves into a lake of viscous fluid-matter. Reforms in 10D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Aphoom Zhah
deity_entry.description_quote: Behold the white flame! Not heat shall you feel as it glows with a cold intensity. Look on this wall of white fire and feel the frost upon your flesh!
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Aphoom Zhah is a living white-gray flickering mass of flame, which gives off a sickly, cold, and unhealthy glow. It is said to dwell somewhere far beneath the ice of the North Pole, or possibly the star Arcturus.

cult.text: Aphoom Zhah has no organized human cult, although it was worshiped by the ancient voormis, and still today by the gnoph-keh.

possible_blessings.name: Strange Vision
possible_blessings.description: Seeing the world differently and opening the mind to cosmic knowledge.

possible_blessings.name: Touch of Cold
possible_blessings.description: Able to freeze matter by touch or radiating a general cold.

deity_entry.encounters: Those in close proximity to Aphoom Zhah's full majesty are liable to find the experience chilly. Contact causes blood to freeze and bodily processes to stop, resulting in instant death.
deity_entry.aura: A coldness beyond mere chill that drives a stake through one's heart. An otherworldliness that is hard to define except as a sense of strange wonder.

magic.spells: Alter Weather, Create Mist of R'lyeh (frosty variant), Dominate (extended range).

powers.name: Shroud of Cold
powers.description: Emits a zone of bitter cold. Those within suffer one penalty die to all physical skills. Hard CON or suffer 1D4+1 damage + 5 CON loss per round.

powers.name: Mind Touch
powers.description: May touch the mind of an individual seeing the entity (e.g. through a telescope). Victim receives 1D10 Cthulhu Mythos and loses 1D10+2 Sanity.

combat.description: May send forth flaming tendrils of cold to strike down those in its presence or touch them to cause flesh to freeze.

special_maneuvers.name: Ice Touch
special_maneuvers.description: Instant destruction of living flesh unless Hard CON roll. Success staves off death but results in 1D10 damage + 3D10 CON loss.

armor.notes: Mundane weapons shatter on contact. Fire is harmful (incendiary bomb 1D10). Vanishes at 0 HP, reforming in 2D10 hours.

deity_entry.name: Arwassa
deity_entry.description_quote: A gross heap of yellow-brown flesh, somewhat humanoid in shape, from which sprouts four thick and long tentacle-like limbs where hands and feet should be. Betwixt the two upper limbs is a giant, rubbery maw instead of a head.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Little is known of Arwassa. It appears to only venture forth during the latter portion of the year (Sept-Nov), suggesting it is otherwise imprisoned, possibly in Central Europe. It outpours a perpetual scream (inaudible to humans) that can drive people to madness and violence.

cult.text: Worshiped by individuals who recruit a small following. Cult leaders seem to be chosen by Arwassa via its scream.

possible_blessings.name: Doom Scream
possible_blessings.description: Able to produce a terrifying scream that harms others (1D4 damage per round) or causes objects to move.

deity_entry.encounters: First contact is signified by the effects of 'hearing' its inaudible scream, causing madness and outbreaks of random violence.
deity_entry.aura: An instant revulsion and comprehension of wrongness. A strange sensation in the ears, although there is no sound.

magic.spells: Cloud Memory, Dampen Light (variant), Fist of Yog-Sothoth, Maws of Pandemonium (variant), Utterance of Bile.

powers.name: Scream
powers.description: Continual scream provokes Sanity roll to all within 1 mile (1.6 km). 1D6 loss immediately, then 1D2 per hour.

combat.description: May attack with each of its four tentacles every round, either inflicting damage or grabbing targets to then eat them.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Seizes and holds a target, who may be crushed for 2D6 damage or eaten for 1D6+4 damage on the following round. Escape with Extreme STR or Hard DEX.

armor.notes: Regenerates 1 hit point per 1 damage consumed by eating victims. If reduced to zero, melts into scum.

deity_entry.name: Atlach-Nacha
deity_entry.description_quote: Somewhat larger than a human, a dark and hairy spider-like thing with eight legs and a toothsome mouth. Upon its front-facing abdomen appears a kind of face, human-seeming and beguiling.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: The Great Spinner devotes its time to fashioning an immense web, which is said to pull and hold multiple dimensions together. Some tomes report that sections of this web can be found in secret places deep in the earth.

cult.text: Atlach-Nacha has no known organized human cult, however individuals have been known to contact the deity.

possible_blessings.name: Spider-Like
possible_blessings.description: Able to move like a spider up walls, spin web from fingers, or have enhanced visual or physical senses.

possible_blessings.name: Spider Limbs
possible_blessings.description: Body is transformed, possessing multiple limbs or spider-like limbs.

possible_blessings.name: Spider Birth
possible_blessings.description: Blessed with hosting a brood of spiders within, able to send forth numerous spiders to act as spies.

deity_entry.encounters: Those exploring deep caves and tunnels may inadvertently come upon a doorway to Atlach-Nacha's web.
deity_entry.aura: A person's skin crawls while in the presence of Atlach-Nacha, and one is likely filled with dread and a terrible foreboding.

magic.spells: All Contact spells; others as Keeper desires.

powers.name: Spider Parasite
powers.description: Can birth small spider-like creatures that attached themselves to other creatures. If the parasite overcomes the host's POW, they gain full control.

combat.attacks_per_round: 4 (leg strike, bite) or 1 (abdomen bash or cast web)
combat.description: May kick out with its legs or bite up to four times a round, or can forgo those attacks and use its body to bash opponents or cast its web.

special_maneuvers.name: Cast Web
special_maneuvers.description: A strong, sticky web is cast. Hard Dodge to avoid. Entangled target must make Opposed STR vs web's STR 100 to break free.

special_maneuvers.name: Bite
special_maneuvers.description: Injects paralyzing venom. Extreme CON to resist for 1D10 rounds.

special_maneuvers.name: Drain
special_maneuvers.description: Paralyzed victim sucked of juices at rate of 3D10 STR per round.

armor.notes: If reduced to zero, flees across web to heal.

deity_entry.name: Azathoth
deity_entry.description_quote: Foolish is he who speaks the name Aztot aloud, for the center of all things sleeps to the music of the spheres lest the hideous chaos should wake and consume everything. Beyond reason lies Aztot, a bubbling black sun of fearsome intensity...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Azathoth is the mindless center of the universe, and has existed since the beginning of the universe. It dwells beyond normal space-time at the center of all things, where its amorphous body writhes unceasingly to the monotonous piping of harsh flutes.

cult.text: Azathoth is little-worshiped. Humans usually call upon Azathoth by accident. Some death cults exist, fixated on the pointlessness of existence.

possible_blessings.name: Touch of Doom
possible_blessings.description: Hands become a channel of the deity, when placed on a human they burn and corrupt flesh.

possible_blessings.name: Teleport
possible_blessings.description: Allows limited movement between points with a charred and blackened outline scorched into the ground.

deity_entry.encounters: Encounters usually occur through its dreams touching humanity. Close contact is surely instant madness and death.
deity_entry.aura: The sheer scale of Azathoth is enough to cause insanity. Its touch is shaded in despair and colored with madness.

magic.spells: All.

powers.name: Devastation
powers.description: The appearance of Azathoth's full form destroys everything around it for 10D10+10 miles.

powers.name: Mindless
powers.description: May send forth a tentacle of negativity, whose touch instantly disintegrates living matter.

combat.description: May strike anything within its vicinity with a tendril of negative energy.

armor.notes: An Elder Sign delivers 3D6 damage and is destroyed. If reduced to zero, implodes and reforms.

deity_entry.name: Bast
deity_entry.description_quote: The statute was a remarkable likeness of the cat goddess, possessing the form of a slender human female with a cat's head; svelte and nimble... The second statue... showed a more frightening aspect. Here, she was coiled and ready to pounce, her teeth bared, her eyes narrow, and her long nails thrust forth.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: One of the few Elder Gods who seems to have taken an interest in or has some dominion over the Earth. Bast is considered to have dominion over the feline species of Earth and Earth's Dreamlands. Some believe Bast is a formless thing who only takes physicality through human perception... What is known is Bast's alignment to earthly cats, a being that will seek retribution for those who consistently act cruelly or harm cats.

cult.text: In Ancient Egypt, Bast was worshiped in the city of Bubastis. Small sects are said to have existed down the years into modern times... Some dreamers recount seeing temples to Bast in the Dreamlands where the cult of the goddess appears to remain active.

possible_blessings.name: Cat Whispers
possible_blessings.description: Able to communicate with cats, using feline helpers as spies, or may call upon a gathering of cats.

possible_blessings.name: Cat Form
possible_blessings.description: Able to transform into a cat (costing 5 or more magic points).

deity_entry.encounters: Rarely does Bast make personal appearances, although when she does it is a fearsome and often fatal encounter. Retribution is usually the motive. Bast may appear as a human female or in bestial feline forms.
deity_entry.aura: A sharp tension and expectation... One feels as if they are constantly being watched and there's a sense of danger and electricity in the air.

magic.spells: Blessing of Bast, Cloud Memory, Deflect Harm, Elder Sign, Evil Eye; others as chosen.

powers.name: Call Cats
powers.description: Can instantaneously summon dozens of cats to her side. In combat, cats leap into the fray and shield Bast.

powers.name: Change Form
powers.description: May appear in human guise or transform into a panther, lion, tiger, or house cat. In big cat form, attacks deal 4D6 damage.

powers.name: Cat Messenger
powers.description: May use any cat to relay a message; sometimes speaking through the cat.

combat.description: Transforms hands into cat-like claws and grows sharp teeth. Attacks ignore mundane armor and cause deep wounds that take twice as long to heal.

armor.notes: Immune to bullets and impaling weapons. May spend magic points to heal damage (1 for 1). If reduced to zero, disappears in black smoke and reforms in 10 hours.

deity_entry.name: Bugg-Shash
deity_entry.description_quote: The painting depicted a black wall of slime, oozing and quivering and glistening in an unwholesome light cast by a crescent moon. Within this twisting black curtain of jelly were many evil-looking eyes and crooked mouths...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Bugg-Shash does not appear to be a native of our universe and allegedly derives from a dark dimension. It appears trapped in its 'home' dimension, only able to venture to Earth by being called through magic... The entity abhors light and only manifests during nighttime hours or in areas of total darkness.

cult.text: Bugg-Shash has no known organized human cult, although its puppets are a sort of cult. Lone sorcerers and those craving power are most likely candidates.

possible_blessings.name: Animate Corpse
possible_blessings.description: Zombie creation; able to give unlife to the dead (costing 5+ magic points).

possible_blessings.name: Kill Light
possible_blessings.description: Diminishes or dampens light in the vicinity (costing 2+ magic points).

possible_blessings.name: Willing Puppet
possible_blessings.description: Grants the deity temporary possession of the body.

deity_entry.encounters: The entity abhors light and only manifests during nighttime hours. Those with correct lore may create an enchanted pentagram to hold it. Bugg-Shash may create flesh puppets from humans reduced to zero Sanity.
deity_entry.aura: The darkness brings fear. Any light sources suddenly go out in the presence of Bugg-Shash. One's stomach churns and tension causes excessive sweating.

magic.spells: Contact Yibb-Tstll, others as desired.

powers.name: Animate Corpse
powers.description: May animate corpses by immersing them in its slimy excretions.

powers.name: Control Light
powers.description: Any light sources go out on arrival. Strong light can dispel it (10 damage/round), normal light causes 1 damage. Can cause all light within 100 yards to go out by expending 1 MP.

powers.name: Whisper
powers.description: Those hearing its whispering mouths must make a POW roll or lose 1D6+2 Sanity.

powers.name: Create Puppet
powers.description: Once a person's Sanity is reduced to zero by whispers, they become a puppet. STR/CON increase by 20+1D10, POW reduced to 05.

combat.description: Uses body mass to swipe, bash, and crush, or utilize kiss attack.

special_maneuvers.name: Kiss of Bugg-Shash
special_maneuvers.description: Envelopes target and suffocates. 1D6 damage per round until death. Escape with Extreme STR.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Bright light deals 1D10 damage/round. Reforms in six months.

deity_entry.name: Byatis
deity_entry.description_quote: A one-eyed being whose beard was a nest of impossibly long trunk-like serpents... mounted on a conical and tapering body possessing spindly legs. Upon two great wings it flew and with two large crab-like claws did it grab and crush...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Touching an image or carving of Byatis awakens the mind of the deity. Ancient lore tells of deep ones who possessed an idol of Byatis. It appears to have been imprisoned through Elder magics... Accounts tell of the 'Berkeley Toad' in the Severn Valley... Whether Byatis is a Great Old One is debatable; perhaps it is the spawn of an Outer God or cousin of Tsathoggua.

cult.text: Though no known human cult is associated with Byatis, it is named in several books of occult lore. Some isolated deep one communities still worship Byatis alongside Cthulhu.

possible_blessings.name: Grow Bigger
possible_blessings.description: Able to increase SIZ by +10 or more points (costing 5+ magic points).

possible_blessings.name: Toad Like
possible_blessings.description: Physical characteristics take on a permanent toad-like quality.

deity_entry.encounters: Encounters mainly concern those who venture into the Severn Valley... The Elder wards may be failing, allowing brief periods of freedom. Byatis increases in size when it feeds.
deity_entry.aura: Darkness and the cold of the earth are features to draw upon, as well as the tension arising from seeing a multitude of great serpents squirming around in the darkness.

magic.spells: All Summon and Contact spells (except Elder Gods).

powers.name: Bigger
powers.description: STR, CON, and SIZ each increase by 3D6 points whenever it feeds upon one human (upper limit 500/400/400).

powers.name: Hypnotic Gaze
powers.description: A human looking into the eyes is compelled to approach unless they succeed an Extreme POW roll.

powers.name: Summons
powers.description: May be summoned by touching a relatively accurate image or idol. Responds 60% of the time.

combat.description: Attack with claws, mouth, or viper-like face tentacles.

special_maneuvers.name: Serpent Tentacle
special_maneuvers.description: Can grab an opponent to hold, crush (3D6), or bring to main mouth (2D6).

armor.notes: If reduced to zero, explodes into a dust cloud. Reforms in one year.

deity_entry.name: Chaugnar Faugn
deity_entry.description_quote: Folds of flesh... from which arms and legs extended... A hulking thing, grotesque and bulbous... Rising out of the corpulent flesh, a head with perhaps three or more small eyes, from which a trunk-like tentacle extended, flaring at its end into a large circular disk.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to have arrived on Earth in pre-history, Chaugnar Faugn is often spoken of as the 'Sitting God' as it is believed the entity rests in a seated position within a secret cave in the mountains of Asia. Sometimes misattributed as the 'Elephant God'... All stories frame the deity in vampiric terms, as one who desires to sup on the lifeforce of others.

cult.text: Worshiped by numerous human cults, many led by those with tcho-tcho blood. One cult, 'The Blood', believed to have existed in Montreal.

possible_blessings.name: Mesmerize
possible_blessings.description: Able to hypnotize others to question them or perform tasks.

possible_blessings.name: Pluck Heart
possible_blessings.description: Causing a heart attack in a touched target (costing 10 MP, 1D10+1 damage).

deity_entry.encounters: Acquisition of an idol may lead to influence or avatar transformation. Kidnapping cases may lead to trafficking for the god's food.
deity_entry.aura: A loathsome feeling comes upon those who touch an idol. In the presence of the entity, the loathsomeness is amplified and blood runs cold.

magic.spells: Curse of Chaugnar Faugn, Summon/Bind Brother of Chaugnar Faugn; others.

powers.name: Mesmerize
powers.description: Causes a single target to be compelled to walk toward the deity.

powers.name: Heart Attack
powers.description: Gaze may cause massive heart attack (CON roll or 2D6+1 damage/unconsciousness).

powers.name: Chosen of Chaugnar Faugn
powers.description: Selects a human to become a companion, draining Sanity until they are psychically linked and physically transformed.

powers.name: Psychic Sending
powers.description: Thoughts bleed into human subconsciousness, causing dreams and obsession.

combat.description: Use hand/feet to crush/kick or face tentacle to bite. Accompanied by 1D6 spawn.

special_maneuvers.name: Hold and Drain
special_maneuvers.description: Target is bitten by trunk mouth. Drained of blood (1D6 damage + 5 CON per round). Permanent loss.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. If reduced to zero, becomes lifeless statue. Reforms after variable time.

deity_entry.name: Cthugha
deity_entry.description_quote: A vast sphere of flame, sending forth burning fingers and spitting scorching torrents of fire. A terrible orb of pain and suffering, glowing red to orange to black.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to dwell near to the star Fomalhaut shackled and bound by Elder wards. Ancient texts cite the deity as master of all fire vampires... Aphoom Zhah is believed to have a connection to Cthugha. Certain accounts suggest enmity between Cthugha and the Outer Gods (specifically Nyarlathotep).

cult.text: Fire cults have existed throughout history. In modern times, rare cults hide behind masks of holy fire. All hold the belief that Cthugha shall cleanse the unworthy.

possible_blessings.name: Touch of Fire
possible_blessings.description: Those touched suffer burns (1D6 damage/round; costing 5 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Fire Starter
possible_blessings.description: Able to start a fire by willpower (costing 5 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Fire Walk
possible_blessings.description: Able to enter a fire and be transported to another fire (costing 5 MP).

deity_entry.encounters: Encounters with minions (cultists or fire vampires). High ranking cultists may have horrendous scars.
deity_entry.aura: Anything touched by Cthugha contains an inner heat. Burning sensation.

magic.spells: Any spell concerning fire.

powers.name: Flaming Entrance
powers.description: Appearing, Cthugha brings 1D100 x 10 fire vampires. Sets everything in vicinity alight. Humans suffer 1 damage/round from heat, increasing to 2 damage/round.

powers.name: Bright as the Sun
powers.description: Can glow more brightly (cost 10 MP). Causes blindness (temporary or permanent depending on duration).

combat.description: Send forth flaming pseudopods or create a flame burst. Anything touched may catch fire.

special_maneuvers.name: Flame Burst
special_maneuvers.description: Range 150 yards. Blankets 20 yard area with fire. Luck roll or incinerated. Success takes 1D10 damage.

armor.notes: Mundane weapons destroyed after first hit. If reduced to zero, implodes and reforms in 1D10+10 years.

deity_entry.name: Cthulhu
deity_entry.description_quote: I have found numerous representations of Cthulhu... Some depict a monstrous amorphous bulk while others suggest a vaguely anthropoid outline, although all share a grand corpulence. All seem to feature an octopean head... surmounted by six or eight eyes... and possessing prodigious claws or hands on hind and fore feet. Again, common to all is a pair of long and narrow wings rising from the back.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Great Cthulhu came down to Earth from Xoth with its star-spawn some 350 million years ago, establishing the hideous city of R'lyeh... Cataclysmic events said to have been instigated by Elder Gods led to the sinking of R'lyeh and the imprisonment of Cthulhu. Prophecy foretells that Great Cthulhu shall break free... heralding the time 'when the stars are right'. For now, Cthulhu lies dead but dreaming in the corpse city of R'lyeh.

cult.text: The human Cthulhu Cult appears to be the most widespread and insidious cult devoted to the worship of the Old Ones... directed by a secretive cabal of elders sometimes known as the 'Deathless Masters'. The cult appears to operate in a cell-like structure... Evidence for these groups has been found in the USA, Greenland, Canada, England, and Greece... Some cult groups have close connections to the deep ones.

possible_blessings.name: Sprout Tentacles
possible_blessings.description: From face or body (costing 5 magic points), granting extra attacks (1D4+DB damage) and a Sanity roll (0/1D6 loss).

possible_blessings.name: Hear Dreams
possible_blessings.description: Able to read the dreams of others (2 magic points per target) and discern their meaning (possibly granting insights into what the target is thinking or will do next).

deity_entry.encounters: Most will encounter Cthulhu through its cult and the many groups therein... Some may come across solitary believers who have been influenced by Cthulhu. Coming face to face with Cthulhu while venturing through R'lyeh would be a life-changing (or ending) experience.
deity_entry.aura: In touching idols of Cthulhu, one feels a greasy sense of falling and an uncanny coldness... Cthulhu radiates an otherworldliness that twists human perception and destroys minds: the smell of rotting seas... sounds become distorted, colors are unfamiliar.

magic.spells: All, except for those concerning Elder beings.

powers.name: Body Modification
powers.description: Cthulhu's body form is not fixed, it is able to warp and reshape its mass at will.

powers.name: Call of Cthulhu
powers.description: Cthulhu's dreams may affect and touch human minds while sleeping... The first time a person receives the Call of Cthulhu they must attempt a POW roll: if failed, they become susceptible to Cthulhu's dreams and must make an immediate Sanity roll (1/1D4 loss).

powers.name: Warp Senses
powers.description: Humans coming into contact with Cthulhu or objects allied to the deity may find their senses distorted and warped... humans suffer a penalty die to all actions other than self-preservation.

combat.description: May stomp and crush with its feet, or scoop with its hands or face tentacles. Otherwise, it may use hands, feet, or face tentacles to kick, swipe, or strike twice a round.

special_maneuvers.name: Scoop
special_maneuvers.description: Each round 1D3 investigators are scooped up by Cthulhu's flabby claws or face tentacles to die hideously.

special_maneuvers.name: Stomp
special_maneuvers.description: Those within 100 yards/meters must succeed with a Dodge roll or be squashed flat (20D6 damage).

armor.notes: Regenerates 6 hit points per round (death at zero hit points). If reduced to zero, bursts into greenish cloud and reforms in 1D10 hours.

deity_entry.name: Cthulhu: B'Moth
deity_entry.description_quote: From the ship's bow we spied the blue mist... it was pouring upward, out of the ocean itself. It carried a strange luminosity that seemed at times to change from blue to green and back again... Carson was the first to exhibit the madness that soon swept through the crew...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Believed to be an avatar or some form of emanation from Great Cthulhu... Agreement rests on the entity's form, that of a luminescent fog or mist of blue, green, and/or yellow coloration, and that it only appears in the sea and never on land. If an avatar, perhaps it is a physical manifestation of Cthulhu's dreaming mind: a living embodiment of will. While being insubstantial, B'Moth's presence affects humans adversely, causing otherwise rational people to quickly descend into primal and savage states.

cult.text: In the historical record, B'Moth's worship seems relegated to primitive cultures, although in more modern times there are hints that this avatar may be favored by some curious coastal communities in North America, Western Canada, Asia, and Polynesia. Historically, ceremonial rites dedicated to B'Moth have encompassed wild and frantic dancing, depraved orgies, and savage acts of violence.

deity_entry.encounters: While sea-based encounters are rare, the appearance of a derelict ship may lead the unwary into a meeting with B'Moth. On land, the avatar's cults provide a tangible and real threat to anyone who happens to come upon their strange communities.
deity_entry.aura: B'Moth's effect upon humans is insidious and profound, amplifying primal instincts while nullifying any sense of propriety and decency. Base emotions flare and cruel rage is the likely result.

magic.spells: B'Moth does not usually utilize spells.

powers.name: Mind Control
powers.description: May read and control the minds of animals and humans. Animals easily fall under its mental faculties. Humans may resist such control with a successful Extreme POW roll.

powers.name: Mind Influence
powers.description: B'Moth's presence causes animals and humans to become savage and bestial, attacking anyone or thing nearby with violent fury. Costs 10 magic points. Humans may resist with a successful POW roll.

powers.name: Infect Dreams
powers.description: Those within 1 mile of B'Moth are subject to loathsome nightmares.

powers.name: Weather Control
powers.description: May spend 5+ magic points to affect the weather within 5 miles.

combat.description: Engulfs victims in its glowing fog. Anyone within the luminescent, swirling mist is overcome by an icy, eerie feeling. Such individuals are automatically susceptible to B'Moth's Mind Influence.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons (incl. bullets). Susceptible to sustained fire (1D6 damage per round). If reduced to zero, reforms in 5D10 years.

deity_entry.name: Cthulhu: Chorazin
deity_entry.description_quote: A distorted and dream-like image of a great hulking mass with squid-like tentacles emerging from an elongated head. Every now and then, sparks of bright green light would shine through the image, which moved and lumbered in a loathsome manner.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Akin in many ways to B'Moth, Chorazin seems to be another avatar of the will of dreaming Cthulhu, a psychic manifestation resembling Cthulhu's physical form seen or heard through technology... It appears that modernity provides the medium for its appearance, as it seems able to 'infect' radio and television waves. Able to use radios, televisions, and other receivers, the avatar spreads the words of sleeping Cthulhu.

cult.text: Chorazin does not appear to be worshipped in its own right, although having a name, it appears as a manifestation of Cthulhu's will. Initially, when contacting a human, it speaks as 'Chorazin' but soon modifies its language to be a representative of a greater power, namely Great Cthulhu.

deity_entry.encounters: Consumers of media (whether radio, television, or the internet) may find themselves targeted by Chorazin. Acquaintances, friends, and family members may be affected... For those affected, the commands of Chorazin vary greatly, from performing the murder of someone opposed to Cthulhu to delivering a message.
deity_entry.aura: A distinct otherworldliness seems to be a feature of contact with Chorazin, making many believe they are being targeted by aliens or even spirits. The voice of the avatar is often distorted and frightening.

magic.spells: Dampen Light (variant), Dominate, Drown Mind, Implant Fear, others at Keeper's discretion.

powers.name: Contact
powers.description: When manifesting, Chorazin preys on the minds of everyone within a 10-mile radius, instigating an initial Sanity roll when folks realize their device is talking to them. If they fail a POW roll, they become obsessed with the device.

powers.name: Physical Manifestation
powers.description: If Chorazin's POW reaches 5,000, it may temporarily manifest as a physical avatar of Cthulhu. In doing so, it exudes its stolen POW in the form of a hissing cloud of white-hot plasma.

combat.description: Chorazin has no physical attacks.

armor.notes: Being an incorporeal entity, it is immune to all weapons. Electrical forms of attack can cause harm; high voltage electricity deals 1D10 damage per round.

deity_entry.name: Cthulhu: Leviathan
deity_entry.description_quote: Bigger than any fish and more like a whale, it must have been over 50 feet from nose to tail. It rose up from the deep, its whiteness filling the water... a pointed snout with two deep-set beady eyes and a great maw of huge teeth that could swallow a man whole.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Most scholars agree that Leviathan is in some way connected to Great Cthulhu... According to the Ponape Scripture, Leviathan is the physical manifestation of Cthulhu, able to roam the oceans at certain times and devouring all in its path... From the supporting evidence, Leviathan rests for great periods of time and rises in brief bursts of savage ferocity. Like an elemental force of destruction and death.

cult.text: This entity is said to be revered by some isolated communities in Polynesia, Hawaii, and along the coastal regions of the Arctic... The deep ones worship Leviathan, holding rituals that are designed to calm its destructive qualities, or at least keep them in relative check.

deity_entry.encounters: Should humanity harm deep one communities or in some way threaten the death-sleep of Great Cthulhu, the threat of Leviathan's appearance becomes real. While a rare occurrence, this avatar's unleashing always brings disaster.
deity_entry.aura: Primal terror, akin to coming face to face with a great white shark or bear (yet greatly amplified), overcomes most who see this 'killing machine' rise from the watery depths.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Shark Coterie
powers.description: Prior to the appearance of this avatar, marine life acts erratically... Only sharks seem unaffected by this desire to flee and instead appear drawn to the area where Leviathan will appear.

powers.name: Tidal Wave
powers.description: The movement of its massive body combined with its will (2 magic points), creates monstrous tidal waves able to capsize boats and devastate coastal communities.

powers.name: Land Walk
powers.description: If warranted, the avatar may leap from the water onto land and 'walk' on its many tentacular growths that sprout from its body.

combat.description: Using its immense bulk, the avatar may smash into a target or use its mouth to bite and swallow.

special_maneuvers.name: Swallow
special_maneuvers.description: Its great jaws can swallow anything SIZ 210 or smaller in one bite; for any living creature death is instantaneous.

special_maneuvers.name: Thrash
special_maneuvers.description: Bites and holds a target; instead of swallowing, thrashes the victim. Initial bite delivers 6D6 damage and on the following round deals 10D6 damage.

armor.notes: If reduced to zero, ruptures and bursts into cloud of gore. Cannot reform for 100 years.

deity_entry.name: Cthylla
deity_entry.description_quote: A thing composed of glistening red-black flesh within an oval outline... Many of these tentacle-limbs ended in hooked claws, although two were wing-like in nature. Its globular head extended and retracted on a thick neck. About the head grew six eyestalks... While its beaked maw was like a set of serrated blades.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to have arrived on Earth with Great Cthulhu, Cthylla may be a particularly significant star-spawn or, according to some, one of Cthulhu's progeny... Cthylla is 'daughter' to Cthulhu and predestined to rebirth 'her' father at some future date... Cthylla is kept imprisoned in R'lyeh, not by Elder wards but rather by Cthulhu's will, due to 'her' value in ensuring that deity's immortality.

cult.text: No human cult exists for Cthylla, and those who mention the entity's name seem never to be heard from again. Such skullduggery stems from the deep ones, who appear to go out of their way to control information regarding Cthylla... Within deep one society, a sect whose name translates as, 'Cthylla's Keepers', are charged with maintaining a blanket of darkness over this deity.

deity_entry.encounters: While direct encounters with Cthylla are most unlikely (unless somehow finding oneself wandering around R'lyeh), those seeking to keep this deity a secret may come sharply into focus for anyone using the god's name in public or otherwise attempting to undertake research in this area.
deity_entry.aura: Secrets, hidden agendas, lies, and general obfuscation abound, with Cthylla hidden at the center of an age-old conspiracy of silence.

magic.spells: Any dealing with Cthulhu, Ghatanothoa, Zoth-Ommog, Ythogtha, Dagon, Hydra, the deep ones, star-spawn.

powers.name: Secret
powers.description: Cthylla's powers have been purposefully kept blank. The truth about this deity remains a secret and something for each Keeper to determine themselves.

combat.description: May attack with 2D6 tentacles per round; each is equipped with retractable razor-like hooks to tear and rend flesh. Alternatively, may smash into opponents with its bulk.

special_maneuvers.name: Grasp
special_maneuvers.description: Tentacles grab and hold a target, allowing Cthylla to either crush (2D6 damage) or draw victims into its beaked maw (1D8+2 damage) on the following round.

armor.notes: Regenerates 1D6 damage per round. If reduced to zero, erupts into burning fluid cloud and reforms in 1D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Cxaxukluth
deity_entry.description_quote: An amorphous, writhing protoplasmic jelly mass that constantly bubbled... From this oil-sheened blackness, it sent forth boneless pseudopods, each as thick as man, but no head did it possess.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Cxaxukluth is believed to be the spawn of Azathoth... Most texts state the deity dwells alone within a 'deep curtain of night,' which is likely a reference to some void or pocket of space... Cxaxukluth is 'apart' from other Mythos deities and is shunned... due to Cxaxukluth's propensity to consume and/or kill other Mythos beings who venture too close.

cult.text: A few human worshipers or followers, who tend to be solo operators inflicted with some shard of cosmic insight... most appear to mirror the deity's behavior in regard to other living things, killing without remorse and eating their kills, which usually extends to cannibalism.

possible_blessings.name: Grant Pain
possible_blessings.description: Touch causes flesh to melt (costing 4 magic points per round), dealing 1D4+1 damage per round.

possible_blessings.name: Absorb Others
possible_blessings.description: Envelopes a person and absorbs them (costing 10 magic points); once absorbed, hit points, STR, and CON are doubled for 1D6 hours.

deity_entry.encounters: It is unlikely that any humans would come upon Cxaxukluth, unless venturing out into the farthest darkness of space. Contact with demented human worshippers is far more probable.
deity_entry.aura: Death and darkness pervade anything influenced by this deity... An oppressive tension, a bleak empty feeling, and a lingering hatred.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Null Magic
powers.description: Any spells cast within 100 yards/meters of Cxaxukluth have a 60% chance of failing; this also applies to enchanted items.

combat.description: Attacks by blindly putting forth plastic-like pseudopods from its bulk, grasping and scooping up anything and everything within its reach.

special_maneuvers.name: Touch of Pain
special_maneuvers.description: Anything touched by Cxaxukluth instantly burns and melts (inflicting 10D6 damage).

special_maneuvers.name: Grasp
special_maneuvers.description: Grabbed by a pseudopod, the target suffers 10D6 damage and, on the following round, is pulled into the Outer God's bubbling mass and absorbed.

armor.notes: Anything physically striking the deity suffers 10D6 damage before any weapon damage is dealt; a few enchanted weapons may be resistant. If reduced to zero, dries up and disintegrates. Reforms in 1,000 years.

deity_entry.name: Cymaeghi
deity_entry.description_quote: A mass of twisting gray-black flesh in which a milky-white orb, an eye of enormous size, was surrounded by clusters of reaching tentacles. The unblinking eye surveyed us and knew us, weeping yellow-white tears that flowed constantly...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Rumors circulate about this entity being connected to Cyegha. Whispers appear to arise from tales of German settlers to Australia in the early 19th century, who are said to have brought with them a 'seed' of a Great Old One. Another rumor speaks of the entity's tears, which are collected by the cult and made into a wine of rare virtue said to cure all ills and grant immortality.

cult.text: The cult is insular and secretive and remains small, primarily in Australia. In sacrificing humans to Cymaeghi, its cultists are allowed to collect its tears, from which they receive vitality. Cultists' flesh becomes withered and bleached, marked with growths that open into horrific eyes.

possible_blessings.name: Create Darkness
possible_blessings.description: Causes a zone of total darkness 20 yards/meters in diameter (costing 2 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Great Weeping
possible_blessings.description: Both eyes constantly weep.

deity_entry.encounters: Unless traveling to Australia, most will remain ignorant of this deity. Wine connoisseurs and collectors may hear rumors of the cult's miraculous bottles.
deity_entry.aura: Despair and darkness. Those who behold Cymaeghi become enthralled by its weeping eye.

magic.spells: Knot Flesh, Liquid Death, Swelling Torment; others.

powers.name: Tears of Cymaeghi
powers.description: Fluid weeping from its eye boosts vitality, healing wounds and curing illness. Repeated use causes permanent CON loss. Consumers may grow eyes on their body through which the deity can see.

powers.name: Wine of Tears
powers.description: Distilled tears. Drinking causes sudden vitality and longevity, but erodes Sanity (1D10+10 loss) and may cause weeping eyes to grow on the body.

powers.name: Drain Light
powers.description: Causes all light sources to go out within a 500 yard/meter area (cost 5 MP).

combat.description: May strike out with its tentacles or use them to grab and crush opponents.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Target suffers 3D6 crushing damage per round. Break free with Extreme STR or Hard DEX.

armor.notes: Minimum damage from impaling weapons. If reduced to 0 HP, disintegrates and reforms in 1D100+200 days.

deity_entry.name: Cythulos
deity_entry.description_quote: Those who enter the fog that surrounds, will find at its heart a formless mass of twisted limbs... From this mass shall extend a crooked hand and arm... Take this hand and be released from your mortal flesh. Take this hand and find oblivion.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: For believers, Cythulos is the embodiment of fate or death. It does not roam, but lingers in a single location surrounded by dense mist, waiting for those who would seek death. It is said to be an 'orb' of Yog-Sothoth by some. Touching its outstretched hand means instant death.

cult.text: Human cults are rare and short-lived as they are primarily death cults. Members meditate on the end of existence and eventually seek their own deaths via the deity.

possible_blessings.name: Befuddle
possible_blessings.description: Causes another person to fall into a confused state for 1D6 rounds (opposed POW roll).

possible_blessings.name: Create Fog
possible_blessings.description: Mist pours from eyes and mouth, creating a dense fog (cost 5 MP).

deity_entry.encounters: Those seeking to explore death may cause the appearance of Cythulos. Statuettes of the deity carry an aura of despair and may be unearthed by archaeologists.
deity_entry.aura: Death and fate figure largely. All things surrounding Cythulos should be laced with a sense of the cosmic indifference or wonder.

magic.spells: Any as desired by the Keeper.

powers.name: Obscure Mist
powers.description: Fog surrounds the deity (1 mile squared). Vision impaired (penalty die). Luck roll to avoid getting lost.

powers.name: Shroud of Bliss
powers.description: Those in the mist may fall into a dream-like hypnotic state (Hard POW to resist). Affected receive visions of their death and may despair, drawn to take the entity's hand and die.

powers.name: Statuettes
powers.description: Handling a statuette may cause visions of death and eventual catatonic state calling out to the deity.

combat.description: Stretches out its single hand, waiting for it to be grasped, or attempts to grasp those nearby.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. If reduced to 0 HP, turns into thick blue liquid that burns through ground. Reforms in 100 years.

deity_entry.name: Cyegha
deity_entry.description_quote: The green eye in darkness sees all. Look not upon its eye lest you spy the darkness behind and within. Be not caught by its writhing and boneless limbs lest you become wrapped in the darkest night and choked of life.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Cyegha might best be described as utter nihilisma being devoid of anything except contempt for all life. It is said to fester in an 'empty' prison... One earthly location appears to be near to the village of Freihausgarten, Germany, where a strange magical ward affects the local population. Each of Cyegha's prisons is said to be guarded by the Vaeyen, lesser entities somehow connected to the deity.

cult.text: It would appear that nearly all cults devoted to Cyegha herald from Freihausgarten, Germany, although some cults with no ties whatsoever to that community have been known to sprout and grow in dark corners of the world. The Freihausgarten cult performs sacrifices to their god while also unknowingly shoring up its prison.

possible_blessings.name: Regenerate
possible_blessings.description: Blessed with automatic healing of 2 hit points per round (death at zero hit points); body becomes permanently disfigured.

possible_blessings.name: Light Aversion
possible_blessings.description: Cannot stand to be in bright light as it causes 1D4 damage per round.

possible_blessings.name: Dark Eyes
possible_blessings.description: Removal of eyes allows perfect night vision (light causes blindness).

deity_entry.encounters: Those who have angered or hindered Cyegha or its cults may come face to face with the nagae. Encounters with the Old One's cults is a probability for those who work or venture beneath towns and cities.
deity_entry.aura: Total darkness, the blackest black, and the absence of light. A terrible freezing cold descends on areas wherein rituals to the deity are performed.

magic.spells: Accursed Eye, Barrier of Pain, Clutch of Nyogtha, Drown Mind; others.

powers.name: Create/Summon Nagae
powers.description: At the cost of 5 magic points, 1D6 nagae appear where Cyegha desires.

powers.name: Dark Mesmerism
powers.description: Enthralls humans to walk toward it or perform tasks (cost 10 MP). Resisted by Extreme POW roll.

powers.name: Drain Light
powers.description: Causes all light sources to go out within a 1-mile area (cost 2 MP).

powers.name: Bestow Vitality
powers.description: Heals any wound or illness for those nearby. Those healed are marked; if they work against the deity, their flesh necrotizes.

combat.description: Tends to float or drift over an area, randomly picking targets to crush with its tentacles.

special_maneuvers.name: Grasp
special_maneuvers.description: Grabbed by a tentacle, the target suffers 8D6 damage per round thereafter. Break free with Extreme STR or Hard DEX.

armor.notes: Minimum damage from impaling weapons. Light of any nature inflicts 1 damage per round. If reduced to 0 HP, fades from existence and reforms in 4D10+10 years.

deity_entry.name: Dagon & Hydra
deity_entry.description_quote: Dagon appeared somewhat humanoid, possessed of a bulbous body from which arms and legs emerged as well as numerous tentacular growths... Hydra's body... was represented as a long and twisting fish-like thing, more like some gigantic eel.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Father Dagon and Mother Hydra are considered the god-like leaders of the deep ones. Accepted wisdom states these two entities were once 'normal' deep ones but have grown to tremendous proportions. They are said to be millions of years old. Some conjecture they are star-spawn of Cthulhu.

cult.text: The worship of Dagon and Hydra by humanity appears to be ancient. In the modern world, worship is seen in the Esoteric Order of Dagon (Innsmouth). Other front organizations exist elsewhere (e.g., Hearts of the Sea Mission in the UK).

possible_blessings.name: Watery Breath
possible_blessings.description: Granted gills to breathe underwater.

possible_blessings.name: Call Deep Ones
possible_blessings.description: Able to summon deep ones in coastal areas.

deity_entry.encounters: Esoteric Order of Dagon, sea-based archaeology, chance sightings at sea.
deity_entry.aura: The qualities of timelessness and hidden depths. Touching a representational idol conveys a sense of the sea and something malign.

magic.spells: Breath of the Deep, Call Cthulhu, Contact Deep One, Wave of Oblivion; others.

powers.name: Summon Minions
powers.description: May summon 2D6 deep ones (2 MP) or a star-spawn of Cthulhu (10 MP).

combat.description: May strike out with kicking, clawing, punching, stamping, and so on, in addition to using their tentacles and body mass to bash and crush.

deity_entry.name: Daoloth
deity_entry.description_quote: An awesome complexity of globes, rods, and cylinders of crystal, metal, and fleshy rubber. No single form could describe it, as it moved and undulated... Machine-like yet living...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: A bizarre, geometric entity, seemingly composed of an ever-shifting conglomeration of geometric shapes. Seeing Daoloth can be disastrous, as the human eye is unable to follow the god's constantly moving form, causing madness. It exists outside our universe. It does not seem to manifest on Earth of its own accord but visits via summons.

cult.text: Human cults appear to be quite rare. Individuals wanting to alter the course of their life or obtain some historic truth are the primary followers. Worshiped by the mi-go and possibly the Great Race of Yith.

possible_blessings.name: Use Angles
possible_blessings.description: Able to move through angles between locations or other bodies (cost 4 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Prediction
possible_blessings.description: Able to predict likely future events in the next 24 hours (cost 10 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Confuse Mind
possible_blessings.description: Imparts complex mathematical patterns causing confusion (penalty die).

deity_entry.encounters: Summons by individuals or cults seeking power or knowledge. Reading certain divinatory texts may unwittingly contact the entity.
deity_entry.aura: A certain mystique and atmosphere of otherworldliness. Ceremonies tend to have the trappings of 'high magic'.
deity_entry.sanity_loss: 1D10/1D100 (first round visible); 1D10 automatic loss every round thereafter.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Containment
powers.description: If not summoned within a magical containment, its form expands and engulfs anyone nearby (approx 20 ft expansion per round). Those engulfed are sent to another dimension.

powers.name: Lift Veils
powers.description: May allow veils of reality to be lifted. Experiencing this provokes 1D10/1D100 Sanity loss and 1D6 loss per day thereafter.

powers.name: Know Past/Future
powers.description: May grant petitioners a vision of things past or future. Costs the recipient 1D10+2 MP and potential Sanity.

combat.description: Daoloth does not use attack forms other than engulfing those around it (see Containment).

armor.notes: Anything touching Daoloth is transported to another place or dimension. If reduced to 0 HP, implodes and reforms in 1D100+500 days.

deity_entry.name: Daoloth: The Sacred Light
deity_entry.description_quote: A single shaft of beaming liquid light descending from above in which colorful splendors of this universe and others shall be visible.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: An avatar of Daoloth used to better interface with beings from this universe. Witnessing its appearance brings 'clear sight' and a means to see beyond constraints of reality. Those who enter the Sacred Light become aware it is a living presence. Knowledge may turn a person into a Splinter of Daoloth.

cult.text: Cult of the Sacred Light. Secretive, with splinter cells in the US. Rumors of influencing politics.

deity_entry.encounters: Summoned via the spell 'Light of Sacred Truth'.
deity_entry.aura: Great secrecy. Profound sense of enlightenment.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Gift of Truth
powers.description: Veils of earthly illusion are ripped apart, revealing cosmic knowledge. Provokes 1D10/1D100 Sanity loss and 1D6 per day thereafter. May turn victim into a Splinter of Daoloth.

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: The Sacred Light

combat.description: Does not use attack forms.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Enchanted weapons can cause harm. If reduced to 0 HP, ceases to exist.

deity_entry.name: Eihort
deity_entry.description_quote: As like an infernal demon... its vast bulk supported by numerous thin and spindly legs... Atop, a spherical mass of sickly ever-reforming eyes and gelatinous wet pulsating skin...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: A monstrous being imprisoned in a labyrinth below England's Severn Valley. Eihort's tunnels are said to exist outside of normal space-time, phasing in and overlaying existing cave systems. Eihort appears unable to depart from its lair due to Elder magic.

cult.text: Known human cults operate in the Severn Valley (Brichester, Camside). Cults often led by a host for Eihort's brood. Gangs of children/youths come under its sway. Some take up Eihort's Bargain.

possible_blessings.name: Brood Carer
possible_blessings.description: Mentally linked to a brood carrier, able to sense when they are in danger.

possible_blessings.name: Brood Carrier
possible_blessings.description: Carries the brood within. Can control these miniature horrors.

possible_blessings.name: Mental Confusion
possible_blessings.description: Cause temporary disorientation in others (cost 5 MP).

deity_entry.encounters: Doorways into the labyrinth. Gangs of malevolent children. Operations of adult cults spreading the Bargain.
deity_entry.aura: Confusion and doubt like a cancerous miasma. A sense of scuttling menace.

magic.spells: Cloud Memory, Enthrall Victim, Flesh Ward, Liquid Death; others.

powers.name: Eihort's Bargain
powers.description: Offers a bargain to intruders. If accepted, implants brood in the human. Brood mature and eventually kill the host. If refused, usually smashes the human.

powers.name: Manipulate Minds
powers.description: Can use Displacement (swap minds), Illusion (sensory manipulation), Magnify Fear, and Pain (inflict damage).

combat.description: May use its numerous legs to kick, its body mass to crush, or can bite.

special_maneuvers.name: Crush
special_maneuvers.description: Body leaps/rolls onto targets within 5 yard area. 5D6 damage if unable to Dodge.

armor.notes: Mundane physical attacks deal minimum damage. Regenerates 3 HP per round. If reduced to 0 HP, dissolves into ooze and reforms in 1D10+20 years.

deity_entry.name: Elder Gods, Lesser
deity_entry.description_quote: Mysterious are they, the lesser-known and unnamed Elder Ones whose time is not yet come. They dazzle the eyes as great shafts of light or as towering pillars of flame, each cast in many hues and colors beyond our ken.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: These unnamed entities are believed to be unformed or immature Elder beings, or perhaps Elder Gods in their own right existing outside our reality. To the human eye they appear as rays of multicolored light, flaming whirlwinds, or some combination of both. Some sources suggest they act as soldiers or prison wardens for the Greater Elder Gods.

cult.text: Few, if any, are worshiped on Earth. Specific individuals may have cause to come to Earth, causing a stir viewed as divine. How people interpret such appearances depends on their cultural outlook.

possible_blessings.name: Cosmic Insight
possible_blessings.description: Grants 1D10+2 Cthulhu Mythos points while reducing Sanity by 1D10+6 points.

deity_entry.encounters: Sightings may be mistaken for angels, demons, or UFOs. Delving around ancient sites of Elder interest or prisons of Great Old Ones may trigger their attention.
deity_entry.aura: True alienness. An otherworldliness overcomes the senses, accompanied by a frightening cold and harsh, confusing lights.

magic.spells: Mind Blast, Oscillating Expanse, Pose Mundane, Soul Singing, Wrack, Wrath of Pazzuzu; others.

powers.name: Telepathy
powers.description: Mentally communicate with any intelligent lifeform; the voice sounds like raging fire or swirling water.

powers.name: Compel
powers.description: Implants a vision demanding a task. Resistance requires Hard POW roll. Failure to comply causes 1 Sanity loss per day.

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: Lesser Elder God

combat.description: Lashes out with shafts of flame or light, or flings opponents away.

special_maneuvers.name: Cast Away
special_maneuvers.description: Target is enveloped in light/flame and hurled 1D10x1,000 yards/meters (6D6 impact damage). Extreme success flings them into space.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane attacks. Regenerates 1 HP per 1 MP spent. Bursts into explosion of light at 0 HP (10D10 damage radius).

deity_entry.name: Fthaggua
deity_entry.description_quote: It burns the sky, sheathed in tongues of red-blue fire, and trailing a flaming tail. No comet is this that charts its movement in curves. Behold the living flame!
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Believed to be the high priest or leader of all fire vampires, or possibly Cthugha's child. It is usually pictured as a mass of gaseous blue flames dwelling near the star Fomalhaut. Some texts say it was banished to 'Ktynga' (Norby's Comet) and is traveling toward Earth, due to arrive in four centuries.

cult.text: Most Cthugha cults place Fthaggua in their devotions but not as a god. The Teachers of Blue Sun hold Fthaggua as a separate deity. Sorcerers may call it for revenge.

deity_entry.encounters: May arrive as Cthugha's attendant or in place of Cthugha. Fire vampires may appear first and call Fthaggua.
deity_entry.aura: Touch is flame, burning and painful. Smell of acrid smoke, air full of ashes, overpowering heat.

magic.spells: Call Cthugha, Incinerate, Power Drain, Summon Fire Vampire, Wither Limb.

powers.name: Heat
powers.description: Burns at 2,012F (1,100C). Touch sets objects alight and causes 2D6 to 8D6 burn damage.

powers.name: Coterie
powers.description: Accompanied by 4D10 fire vampires when traveling.

powers.name: Mind Burn
powers.description: Flaming tendril wraps around head to consume memories. Opposed POW to resist. Victim suffers partial or total memory loss. Luck roll failure causes 4D6 damage (burning head to cinders).

combat.description: Shoots forth or drops coils of bluish lightning-like flames.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Water causes 2 damage/gallon. Fire extinguisher deals 1D6+1. Reforms in 50 days if destroyed.

deity_entry.name: Ghatanothoa
deity_entry.description_quote: Huge, multiple eyed, many mouthed, plastic, squamous, rugose, nightmarish, tentacularthe list could go on but is essentially meaningless. Until we stand before this miasma of death and embrace our doom, we shall not truly know its like.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Once dwelt on Yuggoth, brought to Earth and imprisoned within Yaddith-Gho (a volcano in Mu). Some claim it is the first spawn of Cthulhu. To look upon Ghatanothoa (or a perfect image of it) is to be damned, suffering instant petrification while the brain remains alive.

cult.text: Venerated by lloigor, mi-go, and some serpent folk. Ancient human cults existed in Mu. Modern cults are secretive. Human sacrifices were common.

possible_blessings.name: Visionary Insight
possible_blessings.description: Grants dreams/visions of history, alien landscapes, or future. Grants Cthulhu Mythos points but costs Sanity.

possible_blessings.name: Sight of the Dead
possible_blessings.description: Allows seeing through the eyes of the petrified victims of the god.

deity_entry.encounters: Seeking Mu or artifacts of the deity. Idols may bring doom.
deity_entry.aura: Distinct sense of wrongness. Secrets obscured and hidden.

magic.spells: Summon/Bind and Contact spells for Old Ones/Star-Spawn.

powers.name: Curse of Ghatanothoa
powers.description: Looking at the deity (or a perfect image) requires a CON roll each round. Failure causes 3D10 DEX loss (stiffening). At 0 DEX, victim is permanently petrified into a leather/bone statue. Brain remains alive and conscious, losing 1D6 Sanity/day until insane.

powers.name: Send Vision Message
powers.description: Imparts messages via visions/dreams. Resist with Extreme POW.

combat.description: Uses tentacles to strike/grab or bulk to crush.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Target suffers 7D6 crushing damage per round. Break free with Extreme STR or Regular DEX.

armor.notes: Regenerates 10 HP/round. If 0 HP, disintegrates into dust. Dust cloud requires CON roll or 1D6 choking damage. Reforms in 10D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Ghizguth
deity_entry.description_quote: A large and wrinkled sack of jelly in which a single overly wide mouth gapes... pairs of tiny eyes peering out from folds in the greasy flesh. Instead of legs, it has several long claw-tipped, vine-like tendrils...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to have begat Tsathoggua and is the child of Cxaxukluth. Dwells in the deep oceans or possibly on Cykranosh (Saturn) or Xoth. Arrived on Earth causing boiling oceans. Remains 'chained' to deep oceans, occasionally rising to cause ship disappearances.

cult.text: Little known human cults, possibly small coastal communities. Deep Ones and Mi-Go may offer worship. Shrines to Tsathoggua may contain effigies of Ghizguth.

possible_blessings.name: Gather the Sea
possible_blessings.description: Create oceanic whirlpools capable of capsizing vessels (10 MP per 20ft of vessel size).

possible_blessings.name: Watery Breath
possible_blessings.description: Enables underwater breathing and swimming.

deity_entry.encounters: Rare. Ship disappearances. Cultists seeking to bring Ghizguth and Leviathan (or Tsathoggua) together.
deity_entry.aura: Taste of saltwater and brine. Thoughts of deep, dark things.

magic.spells: Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Command Shoggoth, Create Mist of R'lyeh (variant), Solar Gaze, etc.

powers.name: Change Weather
powers.description: Worsens weather to gales/storms (5 MP).

powers.name: Far See
powers.description: Summon vision of event within 1,000 miles (1 MP).

combat.description: Uses tendrils to rend/tear or entwine/crush.

special_maneuvers.name: Entwine
special_maneuvers.description: Target is held and pulled into mouth to be swallowed. Swallowed victims suffer 5D6 acid/crush damage per round. Escape with Extreme STR or DEX.

armor.notes: Regenerates 1D6 HP/round. Explodes in acid splatter at 0 HP (1D8 damage radius). Reforms in 200 years.

deity_entry.name: Ghroth
deity_entry.description_quote: A red star whose surface is riddled with cracks and strange geography that hide unquiet seas beneath. Great torment shall herald its arrival. Look not closely, lest it opens its great eye and sees you.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: A planet-sized, star-like entity of living gas, ash, and molten iron. Roams the void singing a siren song (Music of the Spheres) that awakens slumbering Old Ones. Its arrival causes natural disasters. Believed to be responsible for the destruction of Shaggai and the K-T extinction on Earth.

cult.text: Few human worshipers; mostly 'death cults' or sorcerer-astrologers. Cult of Ghroth exists in Goatswood. Mi-go are fascinated by it; Shan fear it.

possible_blessings.name: The End is Nigh
possible_blessings.description: Premonitions of calamity via hallucinations/dreams. May lead to enlightenment or despondency.

deity_entry.encounters: Astronomical observation (telescopes, radio astronomy). Magical travel to doomed planets.
deity_entry.aura: Doom, inevitable destruction, insignificance.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Cosmic Realignment
powers.description: Can pull planets into new orbits, destroy planets, cause stars to die/born.

powers.name: Music of the Spheres
powers.description: Never-ending song that awakens dead/slumbering gods. Hearing it drives many insane (1D10/1D100 Sanity loss).

combat.description: Presence alone destroys planets. No conventional combat.

armor.notes: Theoretical destruction via planet-destroying power. Reforms inside Azathoth in 1,000 years.

deity_entry.name: Gla'aki
deity_entry.description_quote: Its slug-like oval body covered in needle-like spines metal of varied colors... A head of sorts at one end, with a vast mouth... three stalk protrusions, each ending in a bulbous eye. Its underside squirmed and wriggled...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Arrived on Earth in a meteorite that shattered, scattering shards/avatars to various lakes (notably Severn Valley). Associated with 'The Revelations of Gla'aki'. Creates undead servants by injecting fluid via spines. Servants eventually suffer 'Green Decay'.

cult.text: Loathsome cult of undead servants. Living humans may worship seeking the 'un-life'. Servants copy/compile the Revelations.

possible_blessings.name: Green Decay
possible_blessings.description: May bestow a spell causing the Green Decay.

possible_blessings.name: Long Life
possible_blessings.description: Blessed with un-life as a servant.

deity_entry.encounters: Near bodies of water containing shards. Dream-pull leads victims to lake. Undead servants reclaiming meteorite fragments.
deity_entry.aura: Damp, rotting, foul. Sense of the alien.

magic.spells: Green Decay; others.

powers.name: Dream-Pull
powers.description: Draws victims to the lake. Success based on MP vs MP. Range reduces chance.

powers.name: Create Servant
powers.description: Drives metallic spine into victim's chest, injecting fluid. Spine kills victim (3D10 damage) or turns them into undead slave. Spine detaches and leaves red wound.

combat.description: Attacks with spines (ramming or shooting).

armor.notes: Spines have 4-point armor/6 HP. If 0 HP, crumbles to dust. Reforms in 1D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Gol-Goroth
deity_entry.description_quote: The depiction showed a monstrous thing, perched atop a great stone pillar. Toad-like and bulbous, its corpulent and scaled flesh sagged in rolls nearly hiding its hindquarters while rising itself upward on two hooved legs. No arms did it possess and, instead, two long tentacles dangled and waved...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Many shrines to this Old One may be found in subterranean temples, although a handful of shrines, looking like tall stone pillars or obelisks, are said to survive in remote parts of the Old World. According to Nameless Cults, Gol-goroth dwells in a sunken temple-prison somewhere in either Hungary or Romania... Given its toad-like visage and subterranean scope, most scholars agree that there must be some form of connection between Gol-goroth and the Tsathoggua.

cult.text: Historically, Gol-goroth appears to have been a popular deity in pre-human society... Monthly rites are a common feature of this deity's cults, and usually include chanting and orgiastic dancing, as well as flagellation and blood sacrifice. Young people are particularly honored by these cults... with many becoming indoctrinated into cult beliefs and willingly offering themselves as sacrifices.

possible_blessings.name: Toad Form
possible_blessings.description: Bestows the ability to transform into a toad-like creature, able to squeeze through small places, swim, and lurk in dark places.

possible_blessings.name: Beguile Others
possible_blessings.description: Grants the power to charm or beguile other humans, enabling cultists to draw unsuspecting innocents into the clutches of a cult.

deity_entry.encounters: While cults appear mostly insular with no overreaching inter-cult operations, the tendency of Gol-goroth worship to exist in small clusters across a widespread area means that encounters with cult members are likely in certain areas of the world. Given the deity's capacity for making personal appearances during cult rituals, face to face contact is possible.
deity_entry.aura: Secrets of a dark and sinister hue coalesce around this entity whose cultists often mask the truth of their beliefs behind more 'traditional' pagan practices and gods. In physicality, Gol-goroth seems to amplify one's inner fears.

magic.spells: Animate Flesh Thing, Barrier of Pain, Blight/Bless Crop, Call Lightning, Contact Ghoul, Contact Formless Spawn, Fury, Maggots; others.

powers.name: Beguile
powers.description: Those viewing Gol-goroth see their darkest fears (1D6+1/3D8 SAN loss). Alternatively, can spend 3 MP to appear in a charming/beautiful form that compels viewers to approach.

powers.name: Empower Stone
powers.description: Places magical energy into a stone/pillar. Touching it during waning moon grants bonuses (MP, spells, POW increase, etc.).

combat.description: May use tentacles, hindleg hooves, and bite in a combination of attacks, or leap on top of opponents and crush them.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Tentacles grab opponent. Held victims can be bitten (3D6+4) or flung (2D6) on following round.

special_maneuvers.name: Leap
special_maneuvers.description: Jumps up to 20 yards to crush targets with bulk. Dodge to avoid.

armor.notes: Mundane physical attacks deal minimum damage. Enchanted weapons inflict damage but cannot impale. Immune to cold. If reduced to 0 HP, melts into corruption and reforms in 1D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Groth-Golka
deity_entry.description_quote: Know this as a winged demon whose countenance resembles a wicked avian terror with fiery eyes of evil intent in which the flames of Hell doth burn brightly. From the darkest of places, it comes with an awful beak that doth slice like the sharpest of knives...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: According to the Book of Eibon, Groth-Golka resides beneath 'Mount Antarktos' (somewhere in the South Polar region) upon a 'Black Cone.'... The Conspiracies of Yeal remarks that this entity is 'brother' to Mnomquah... The pre-historical record... has accounts concerning the worship of bird-like deities, and most scholars agree that temples to Groth-Golka existed in ancient Bal-Sagoth, Atlantis, and Hyperborea.

cult.text: The cult of Groth-Golka may once have been particularly powerful in both Africa and South America... Otherwise, cults honoring this Old One seem rare, and, where they do appear, are small affairs.

possible_blessings.name: Clear Sight
possible_blessings.description: Grants the devoted the ability to see the Old One and its minions (the fishers from outside) without nightmarish consequences.

possible_blessings.name: Rebirth
possible_blessings.description: Devoted followers may be eaten and reborn as a strangely shaped egg that hatches into a fisher from outside.

possible_blessings.name: Insight
possible_blessings.description: Allows a glimpse of truth concerning the Black Cone.

deity_entry.encounters: Polar explorers would do well to avoid seeking out Mount Antarktos... Archaeologists may encounter remnants of this Old One's worship... Those magically inclined researchers may find themselves traveling through a Gate only to inadvertently appear in the presence of Groth-Golka.
deity_entry.aura: Contact with anything connected to Groth-Golka is liable to produce cold sweats, increased heart rate, and result in either nightmares or waking visions filled with horrible bird-like creatures.

magic.spells: As the Keeper desires.

powers.name: Minions
powers.description: May summon 1D6 fishers from outside at will.

powers.name: Foul Imagery
powers.description: Artistic representations cause adverse reactions. Hard POW roll or suffer nightmares (1 Sanity loss/night). Fumble causes brooding introspection. Requires destruction of image or 5 days psychoanalysis to cure.

combat.attacks_per_round: 4 (bite, skewer, whip) or 1 (tail spikes or body smash)
combat.description: May bite or skewer with its beak, use its tail to whip, body smash, or shoot out dart-like spikes from its hide.

special_maneuvers.name: Tail Spikes
special_maneuvers.description: Can project spikes like darts. 1D10 spikes, 1D2 damage each. Ignores armor. Removal causes 1 damage unless Medicine roll made.

armor.notes: If reduced to 0 HP, consumed by maggots. Reforms in 4D10+40 years.

deity_entry.name: Han
deity_entry.description_quote: Know it as 'HAN,' who comes veiled in mist and with the howling of dogs. Wrapped in a black cloak and the smell of the open grave is He who stands taller than a man, whose grinning skull face burns with eternal flames.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Han appears to be a lesser entity... the case seems stronger for it being a unique entity with some connection to Yig... Appearances of Han suggest it is a harbinger of doom and prophecy... De Vermiis Mysteriis states that Han dwells upon the hidden Plateau of Leng... It should be noted that the nomenclature of 'Han' is the same as the name given by the Lakota peoples of the Great Plains to the personification or spirit of darkness.

cult.text: Han has little in way of earthly human cults, but some of the Cult of Yig venerate its name. The entity is said to have been worshiped by the serpent folk and possibly still by the people of K'n-yan... The Temple of Futures in the Dreamlands is believed to hold Han foremost in its devotions.

possible_blessings.name: Foresight
possible_blessings.description: Grants limited precognition to divine future events. Costs 1 Sanity minimum; seeing own death costs 1D4+1/2D10.

deity_entry.encounters: Initial encounters may see Han first appear as a shadow within a mist, but it may later take on a more substantial form-usually that of a humanoid-like entity wrapped in a black cloak and a dense fog.
deity_entry.aura: Things hidden and obscured, cloaked in mist and covered in darkness are the tokens of Han. Illumination and truth only come at the end.

magic.spells: Mainly divination spells; others as Keeper desires.

powers.name: Prophecy
powers.description: Can provide accurate insights into the future. Message is dire and portends death/destruction. Sanity loss varies.

powers.name: Black Gale
powers.description: Increases mist movement to create wind (5 MP). Shatters windows, throws people. DEX roll to keep footing or suffer 1D6 damage. Can increase severity.

powers.name: Shadow Creatures
powers.description: Cloak fragments become bat-like/serpentine shadow creatures. Can spy or attack (1 damage/round). Can produce 1D100 creatures.

powers.name: Veil of Mist
powers.description: Covers 50-yard radius. Causes hallucinations (howls, faces). 1 Sanity loss/round. Penalty die to sight/hearing skills.

combat.description: Attacks by touching a target with its shadowy skeletal hand, causing 1D100 POW to be drained.

special_maneuvers.name: Withering Touch
special_maneuvers.description: Targets may Dodge if they spot the hand. If POW reaches zero, victim dies, leaving withered husk. Survivors age 1D10 years per 5 POW lost.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons (incl. bullets). If reduced to 0 HP, fades to nothingness. Reforms in 1D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Hastalk
deity_entry.description_quote: Seemingly formless, its touch corrupts entire worlds. Composed of many parts, all interconnected, it ranges the void seeking out life to be changed and consumed. None may stand before it.
