deity_entry.main_entry_text: Perhaps the most insidious of the Old Ones, Hastalk is a gestalt entity composed of millions of parts at the microbial level... Hastalk seems to be akin to a microorganism, capable of infecting ecosystems by amplifying and altering existing contagions... For most scholars, their conception of Hastalk is often wayward and imprecise, likening the entity to a disease and failing to understand that, rather than a contagion, Hastalk is a mutating force.

cult.text: While no organized human cult appears to operate, isolated groups and malevolent individuals may seek to 'nurture' and call to consciousness Hastalk on Earth.

possible_blessings.name: Carriers
possible_blessings.description: Cultist may carry a sentient element of Hastalk within them, bestowing their touch with a mutable agency that causes sickness. The carrier eventually mutates.

deity_entry.encounters: Encounters may feature portions of Hastalk waking and causing local untoward effects, some of which may be beyond the notion of disease and instead concern mutation on a grander scale... Otherwise, lone scientists, crazed cultists, and the like may seek to use or fall foul of Hastalk.
deity_entry.aura: The sense of a dormant, lurking terror that cannot be seen. Of mind-bending mutation at the cellular and more complex levels.

magic.spells: n/a

powers.name: Change
powers.description: Causes mutations in cells and living matter. Complex life may mutate if CON roll failed. Animals/microbes automatically affected. Mutated diseases may cause delusional fevers and Mythos visions.

combat.description: Possesses no physicality or ability to engage in combat, nor spellcasting powers.

armor.notes: Magic is the only effective means to dispel, limit, or kill portions of Hastalk.

deity_entry.name: Hastur
other_names: That Which Should Not Be Named
deity_entry.description_quote: It rules beyond the ken of man... I have seen it in my dreams: the boneless limbs bulging outward from its corpulent and sickly body, the myriad of tentacles that seek to grasp and entwine...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: The Unspeakable One dwells near the star Aldebaran... It is said to share some form of kinship with Great Cthulhu... The Necronomicon makes mention of this Old One, stating that saying its name aloud is to court its attention... Seemingly, the Unspeakable One is confined... by the will of the Elder Ones. The fabled Lake of Hali... is its prison.

cult.text: The Cult of Hastur is well established on Earth... most groups are isolationist in outlook... The character of such groups varies wildly, from the debased and primal to intellectual and calculated... Some cults prefer to venerate the Unspeakable One through its other forms, with humanity apparently most favoring the King in Yellow.

possible_blessings.name: Alien Wisdom
possible_blessings.description: Implantation of cosmic knowledge and spells.

possible_blessings.name: Allies
possible_blessings.description: Establishment of a link with an alien servant (byakhee or spawn).

possible_blessings.name: Unspeakable Oath
possible_blessings.description: Afforded to the most blessed, who accept the Oath and join with the deity.

possible_blessings.name: Boneless
possible_blessings.description: Able to rapidly dissolve bones and become a flexible sack of living flesh.

deity_entry.encounters: Most will encounter Hastur through its cult... The appearance of the Yellow Sign or the text of The King in Yellow may be the sparks that light the touch paper.
deity_entry.aura: A sense of slipperiness and moist unpleasant things... An inner darkness conceals the rotting core... An overwhelming feeling of everlasting antipathy swells.

magic.spells: Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Bring Pestilence, Circle of Nausea, Drain Youth, Liquidity, Oscillating Expanse, Possess Corpse, Possession, Power Drain, Shrivelling, Song of Hastur, Summon Byakhee, Swelling Torment, Touch of Decay, The Unspeakable Promise, Wrack; others.

powers.name: Body Modification
powers.description: Physical form is not fixed; can warp/reshape mass at will.

powers.name: Corruption
powers.description: Encountering Hastur may infect victim with seed of corruption (Hard POW). Causes tiring, then flesh rot (APP loss), visions (Sanity loss). Host offered Unspeakable Oath to stop pain.

powers.name: Say My Name
powers.description: Vocalizing 'Hastur' risks drawing attention (Luck roll). Consequences include inspection by minions, misfortune, or dreams of Hali.

powers.name: Warp Senses
powers.description: Senses distorted/warped. Reality bends. Extreme POW to avoid penalty die to actions.

powers.name: Earthly Manifestation
powers.description: Can only be summoned to Earth when Aldebaran is above the horizon (Oct-March). Psychic appearance anytime.

combat.description: Attacks with claws/tentacles and randomly gathers up those nearby.

special_maneuvers.name: Gather
special_maneuvers.description: 1D3 random humans grabbed. Crushed (13D6) or held (1D6).

armor.notes: Regenerates 5 HP/round. Explodes if 0 HP, reforms in 2D10 hours.

deity_entry.name: Hastur: Amber Elder
deity_entry.description_quote: This human-seeming apparition appears decked in shimmering robes of amber hue, which open to reveal a husk-like figure within, emaciated with peeling and dry skin and deathly pale. Its face is like a mask, although it possesses but a single yellow eye within its forehead.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: This avatar is considered to only appear on Earth... It is said to reside in a temple known as the 'Amber Chambers' that sits upon the Plain of U'Long... The Amber Elder appears to function in ways not dissimilar to the King in Yellow... this avatar seems to act as a herald or voice of the Unspeakable One.

cult.text: A lesser number of Hastur cults place the Amber Elder at the core of their devotion... Ceremony and ritual figure largely for these cults.

deity_entry.encounters: Warnings of dire portent and forthcoming disaster may be heralded by the appearance of this avatar... Those who seek the answer to a question or some hidden information may be directed to find the Amber Chambers.
deity_entry.aura: A certain sense of mysticism surrounds this avatar, of forbidden secrets and enlightenment, as well as a feeling of things being out of step with reality.

magic.spells: Knows all spells.

powers.name: Unsolvable Puzzle
powers.description: Sets a mental puzzle impossible to solve without a critical INT success. Victim remains catatonic until death or solution.

powers.name: Dire Insight
powers.description: May impart knowledge, spells, rituals. Portents of future events.

powers.name: Become the Gate
powers.description: Can open a Gate at will.

combat.description: Attack with tentacle limbs, embrace maneuver, or psychic blast.

special_maneuvers.name: Embrace
special_maneuvers.description: Target grabbed and drained of lifeforce (1D10+5 CON + 1D4 HP per round).

special_maneuvers.name: Psychic Blast
special_maneuvers.description: 1D10 damage to all within 5 yards. Extreme POW halves damage.

armor.notes: If reduced to 0 HP, crumbles to dust. Reforms in 24 hours.

deity_entry.name: Hastur: The King in Yellow
deity_entry.description_quote: Hark! Comes the Yellow King! Regaled in a gown of yellow... Majestic, he glides over the ground to take his throne in Lost Carcosa... See, his spindly and taloned fingers rise to lift the hood of his gown, reveal the Pallid Mask within!
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Disagreement surrounds the King in Yellow with some recognizing the entity as a singular being with its own agenda, while the majority posit the King as the primary avatar of He Who Is Not To Be Named... Seemingly, the King appears either in a regal robe and cloak of many yellow hues or in a tattered gown... Usually, its face is hidden behind the Pallid Mask... The color yellow seems to characterize an association with corruption, decay, disease, as well as decadence, which are embodied in the Yellow Sign... Indeed, the King in Yellows agenda seems to be quite clear: to establish 'Carcosa' across all things.

cult.text: On Earth, cults of the King in Yellow tend to be small clusters of like-minded people or individuals who possess above-average intelligence. Often, such people favor a bohemian or decadent lifestyle... Most are misguided, believing the King in Yellow to embody high ideals...

possible_blessings.name: The King in Yellow
possible_blessings.description: Gifted the playscript, becoming obsessed. Opens mind to King, spreading corruption.

possible_blessings.name: Artistic Amplification
possible_blessings.description: Blessed with enhanced artistic ability to create bizarre works.

possible_blessings.name: Dreams of Carcosa
possible_blessings.description: Granted visits to Carcosa in dreams.

deity_entry.encounters: Encounters usually begin in small ways, with corruption appearing at the margins of one's life... The appearance of the Yellow Sign or the text of The King in Yellow may be the sparks... Once a person has become fully consumed, they are either brought before the King or, on occasion, the King visits them.
deity_entry.aura: Corruption and decay lie at the heart of all things touched by the King in Yellow. Sickness and revelation figure, as does the impending sense of inevitable doom.

magic.spells: Barrier of Pain, Bespeak the End of the Day, Bring Pestilence, Call Hastur, Cause Disease, Compel Flesh, Dominate, Implant Fear, Maggots, Nullify Device, Send Dream, Song of Hastur, Touch of Decay, The Unspeakable Promise, The Yellow Sign; others.

powers.name: Gaze of the Yellow King
powers.description: Induces fear by staring. Costs victim 1D6 Sanity/round. Extreme POW to avoid.

powers.name: Seed of Carcosa
powers.description: Implants vision/desire to find Carcosa. Obsession leads to Sanity loss and eventual calling to Carcosa.

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: King in Yellow

combat.description: Robes are like razors. Pseudopods behind mask can strike or kiss. Gaze instills fear.

special_maneuvers.name: Kiss
special_maneuvers.description: Pseudopod extends and latches onto target, draining 1D10 POW/round. Sever with 6 damage.

armor.notes: If reduced to 0 HP, vanishes in blinding light. Reforms in Carcosa in 1D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Hastur: The Ravening One
deity_entry.description_quote: Before us it appeared, falling from the sky in a fury of sound... Through the smoke it rose... possessed of a dark ovoid body from which grew long and writhing appendages, each ending in a multitude of wicked-looking blade-like tentacles.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Most agree that this avatar seems to embody the Unspeakable One's rage or hatred... sent forth to mete out death and punishment... The Necronomicon speaks of a spell to call down this vicious avatar when Aldebaran is above the horizon... According to the rare accounts... its arrival causes those with knowledge of true cosmic order... to experience nightmares.

cult.text: No known human cult exists for this awful avatar, although wise members of the Cult of Hastur make sacrifices and tokens of appeasement to this entity to ensure its goodwill.

deity_entry.encounters: Those seeking revenge and bloody retribution on others may be enticed to attempt to summon and bind this entity... Those who have crossed Hastur in some way may find themselves beset with terrifying nightmares.
deity_entry.aura: Its presence is signaled by an icy wind that seems to blow from the stars themselves. Radiating from this entity are psychic waves of animosity and rage.

magic.spells: Bait Human, Circle of Nausea, Death's Breath, Drain Youth, Grasp of Cthulhu, Wrack; others.

powers.name: Provoke Fear
powers.description: Radiates aura of fear within 100 yards. Hard POW or become panicked (penalty die). Fumble causes reckless/catatonic state.

combat.description: Strikes with razor-tipped tentacles or grabs to devour brain.

special_maneuvers.name: Tentacle Strike
special_maneuvers.description: Attacks with 2D10 razor-talons, each inflicting 1 damage.

special_maneuvers.name: Devour Brain
special_maneuvers.description: Entangles target. Next round burrows into head (1D6 damage + 1D10 INT drain). Third round onwards, 1D10 INT drain. Zero INT = death.

armor.notes: If reduced to 0 HP, bursts. Reforms in 1D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Hziulquoigmnzhah
deity_entry.description_quote: It had a toad-like shape... covered in wet fur that gathered in clumps. Proportionally, its legs were slender and short... while its arms were longer and ended in spindly claw-like fingers. Its head emerged on a thick neck... with a snapping beak-like mouth and clusters of tiny red eyes.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: This lesser-known and bizarre-looking being is said to be a relative of Tsathoggua and Ghisguth, and the progeny of Cxaxukluth... Apparently, Hziulquoigmnzhah is believed to dwell on Cykranosh (Saturn), where it swims in a sea of molten metal... Seemingly, Hziulquoigmnzhah is not bound to any particular place... which would strengthen the argument for it being an underdeveloped Old One.

cult.text: While no known human or Earth-bound cult exists... the entity is worshiped on Cykranosh by millions of its inhabitants.

possible_blessings.name: Armor of Cykranosh
possible_blessings.description: Blesses followers with a casing of metal (5-point armor, -1 Move).

deity_entry.encounters: Unless the time to take to the skies and travel to Earth has come, encounters on our planet would seem limited to contact with potential cultists wishing to contact or attract this Old One.
deity_entry.aura: Much of what has been written about Hziulquoigmnzhah suggests it has an affinity with metal.

magic.spells: As desired by Keeper.

powers.name: Bind Metal
powers.description: At cost of 5 MP, may vomit forth metal objects (weapons, artifacts) as gifts.

combat.description: May spit caustic saliva or metal shards, or crush/bite.

special_maneuvers.name: Spit
special_maneuvers.description: Caustic saliva (1D6+4, eats skin) or metal shard (2D6).

special_maneuvers.name: Crush
special_maneuvers.description: Rolling bulk deals 5D6 damage.

armor.notes: Regenerates 10 HP/round (cost 5 MP). Immune to fire, electricity, chemicals. If 0 HP, implodes to metal ball. Reforms in 1D100+10 years.

deity_entry.name: Idh-yaa
deity_entry.description_quote: The pale idol pictured a great worm-like thing, suggestive of enormous size, with numerous growths of a crystalline nature and pseudopods extending outward. Detailed in miniature, these limbs clutched terrified human figures, with some being brought to its giant-sized mouth to be consumed.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: This pulsating and eternally writhing entity is thought to dwell on or near to the double star Xoth... According to the Ponape Scripture, Idh-yaa joined with Cthulhu to produce the entities known as Cthylla, Zoth-Ommog, and Ghatanothoa. The Necronomicon mentions Idh-yaa briefly, stating that the deity is unable to move from Xoth... Some scholars have posited that Idh-yaa is akin to or the same as Shub-Niggurath... The wizard Eibon wrote that Idh-yaa would one day give birth to a being he described as the 'Augmentus Occisor,' an entity so powerful as to contend with the might of Azathoth.

cult.text: Seemingly sessile, Idh-yaa's worship seems primarily centered on the native Xothans, although numerous cultures on alien planets revere this deity's absolute destructive and creational power. The mi-go are one such race... No human cults exist on Earth at this time.

possible_blessings.name: Strange Birth
possible_blessings.description: Those blessed may give birth or produce strange offspring possessing Old One characteristics. In humanity, both males and females may be the 'parent,' with the blessing being bestowed magically.

deity_entry.encounters: Contact with Idh-yaa on Earth is rare... Those contacting or somehow summoning a portion of the deity to Earth may find the ground cracks violently open, revealing a milky-white glowing liquid below from which tendrils of mist rise... Other times, Idh-yaa may manifest in its worm-like form, bursting up from the ground or floating down from the stars.
deity_entry.aura: Anything touched by Idh-yaa possesses a distinct coldness... A sense of timelessness and the infinity of the void are likely to overwhelm those who encounter the deity.

magic.spells: All spells.

powers.name: Cosmic Wisdom
powers.description: Those who behold the entity may be blessed with cosmic wisdom... Such sight may grant 1D10+2 points of Cthulhu Mythos while also provoking a Sanity roll (1D6/2D6+2 loss).

powers.name: Creation
powers.description: The entity exudes a sticky white slime... Those touching this slime (or those swallowed by the deity) may be partially or fully transformed by contact if they fail a Luck roll. Full transformation sees the victim secrete a jelly-like substance that hardens into a shell; in time, this shell cracks open to reveal the victim has metamorphized into a full monstrosity.

combat.attacks_per_round: 1 per available target (pseudopod, bite, or swallow) or 1 (crush)
combat.description: May use pseudopods to strike or grab, use its bulk to crush, or bite or swallow.

special_maneuvers.name: Swallow
special_maneuvers.description: Target is swallowed whole. Must make a Hard CON each round; once failed, the victim succumbs to strange magics, melting into a pile of twisting flesh from which a 'new' creature is birthed. Can cut way out by dealing 10 damage to the interior.

armor.notes: Regenerates 5 hit points per round (death at zero hit points). If reduced to zero, melts into a large pool of slime, killing anything it touches. Reforms on Xoth in 1D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Iod
deity_entry.description_quote: First, a dark shadow appeared, consuming all light. Then, a burst of blinding light from which Iod emerged. Something like a conglomeration of crystal, flesh, and vegetable, it was semi-transparent and pulsed with a sickening inner light. A huge, many-faceted eye contained in membranous skin coated in a liquid film...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to be worshipped by the inhabitants of Bel Yarnak... this Old One was also known to the peoples of Atlantis and Mu as 'The Shining Hunter.'... The Book of Iod... presents this Old One as the harbinger of doom, a death-dealing anti-life godhead... In a manner not unlike the terrifying hounds of Tindalos, Iod sometimes manifests as a hunter, tracking and pursuing those who have somehow crossed its path.

cult.text: Occasionally, a small group or lone sorcerer chooses to serve Iod in the hope of receiving blessings in the form of magical knowledge or as a means to direct dire retribution against those who have been perceived to have wronged them. Such cults practice ritual murder and often embrace death.

possible_blessings.name: Film of Shadow
possible_blessings.description: The follower drinks from the liquid that covers the deity. Once consumed, the liquid becomes part of their flesh, enabling them to 'melt' into a shadow-like form.

possible_blessings.name: Unbirth
possible_blessings.description: Cultists practice ritual murder... a chosen one is brought back to unlife by the power of Iod. They remain 'alive' despite their corrupting frame and, according to some accounts, cannot be killed.

deity_entry.encounters: Most are liable to encounter Iod via its loathsome cultists or those despicable wizards who would delve into death magic and necromancy. Certain actions or being witness to certain sights may mark a person or persons with the eye of Iod, with them being hunted down and killed.
deity_entry.aura: The deity's white light is all-encompassing and reveals the truth and the inescapable horror at the heart of all existence. This light burns cold and is death.

magic.spells: Animate Flesh Thing, Awful Doom of Cerrit, Breath of Pazzuzu (variant), Enthrall Victim, Liquid Death, Possession, Sense Life, Sirens Song; others.

powers.name: The Hunt
powers.description: Those marked by Iod suffer nightmares of being pursued (1 Sanity loss/day). Iod will track down that person in 1D100 days. The victim may escape by dispelling the Old One, 'killing' it, or using spells to hide.

combat.description: May strike out with its tendril-like arms, causing those hit to be paralyzed. Thereafter, Iod plunges its many limbs into the victim and drains their lifeforce.

special_maneuvers.name: Paralysis
special_maneuvers.description: Target hit is immobilized if they fail an Extreme POW roll. Victim can attempt to roll once per round to escape.

special_maneuvers.name: Lifeforce Drain
special_maneuvers.description: Once paralyzed, Iod drains POW at 20 points per round. At zero POW, the brain remains alive in a dead body.

special_maneuvers.name: Flash
special_maneuvers.description: Emits wave of dazzling light (10 yards). Combined CON and POW roll or suffer 1D4 burn damage.

armor.notes: Mundane weapons deal minimum damage. If reduced to zero, bursts in dazzling white light. Reforms in 2D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Ithaqua
deity_entry.description_quote: It strides across the sky, immense and wraith-like... a giant humanoid wreathed in ice-cold winds and snow blizzards, sometimes a skeletal thing, and, at others encased in white-blue flesh... darkness lies at its heart: its two red eyes burn as though they were stars.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: The Great Wind-Walker has some bond with the Earth, with reports citing its appearance within the Arctic and sub-Arctic regions... The Old One is characterized in lore as stalking the wastes, appearing before hapless travelers and, sometimes, hunting down and carrying off people to who knows where... Historically, the term 'Wendigo' has been used as a name for Ithaqua... Ithaqua's purpose remains somewhat unclear, although most agree that the deity endures some form of suffering... its binding appears to cause the Old One great distress.

cult.text: Organized worship of Ithaqua tends to be located within the boundaries of its earthly domain... All cults of Ithaqua seem to share the practice of flesh eating, with some including cannibalism. Another common practice seems to be initiation through wilderness survival.

possible_blessings.name: Become Wind-Walker
possible_blessings.description: Those embraced by Ithaqua may undergo a change, permanently turning them into wind-walkers.

possible_blessings.name: Token of Ithaqua
possible_blessings.description: Granted an item (medallion, etc.) holding a portion of the Old One's power. Touching it conveys a shock and creates a bond with the deity.

possible_blessings.name: Touch of Ice
possible_blessings.description: Grants ability to withstand cold.

deity_entry.encounters: Explorers of the remote wilds may hear the cry of Ithaqua and its children... Others may come to hear of the Great Wind-Walker through odd folk tales or evidenced through unusual practices, such as placing pouches of salt around doors and windows.
deity_entry.aura: A devastating and incredible coldness suffuses the places touched by Ithaqua, causing hands to numb and breath to fog. Tallying too long brings an undeniable chill to one's bones and heart.

magic.spells: Call Lightning, Fury, Nullify Device, Possess Corpse, Send Dream, Temporal Rip, Wrath of Pazzuzu; others.

powers.name: Howl
powers.description: Hearing the howl requires a Sanity roll (1/1D6). Failed Sanity requires a POW roll. Failed POW means the character is touched by Ithaqua and may later fall under its command or begin changing into a wind-walker.

powers.name: Command Elements
powers.description: Create snowfall, temperature drops, and blizzards up to 100 miles. Can cause mighty winds to whisk people into the air (STR roll to resist). 5 MP increases wind severity.

powers.name: Air Walk
powers.description: May move freely across the sky.

combat.description: May stomp and strike, or use its bite or claws to tear, grab, and crush.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Uses claws or bite to grab. Held victims can be bitten (6D6), crushed (8D6), or flung (4D6). Break free with Extreme STR or DEX.

armor.rating: 10-point skin or fur covered in thick rime
armor.notes: If reduced to zero, dematerializes leaving an echoing howl. Reforms in 1D100+10 days.

deity_entry.name: Ithaqua: Death-Walker
deity_entry.description_quote: The storm came upon us suddenly, violent and dark... As we looked skyward, we saw the clouds churning and bellowing, forming a gigantic face that was fearsome to behold. It was a skeletal-like face, diabolical, and full of fury...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: This avatar of Ithaqua manifests either as a violent storm or as a snow blizzard. If a storm, the terrible visage of a human-like figure or face (often skeletal) may be seen at its heart... In many ways, this avatar appears to embody the elemental ferocity of the Great Wind-Walker, an unrestrained, primal, and ultimately unstoppable force. One might suspect that Death-Walker is unleashed when Ithaqua's fury reaches an uncontainable point.

cult.text: Death-Walker has some following among the peoples of the sub-Arctic region in both America, Siberia, and Iceland. While most do not worship the entity, many may make token gestures to appease the 'Coming Storm'... One particular group, known among themselves as the Storm Born, is said to secretly hold rites on the Shetland Islands.

deity_entry.encounters: Those traveling in the subarctic and arctic regions may find themselves witnesses to the outbreak of Death-Walker. Worse, those who have somehow interfered with Ithaqua's schemes or those of its cult may find this avatar coming upon them, venting its fury.
deity_entry.aura: Primal and unrestrained rage embodied within severe weather. A sense of forces so great, as to break people like matchsticks.

magic.spells: Does not normally utilize spells.

powers.name: Elemental Rage
powers.description: Causes devastating storms with hurricane force winds, driving rain, hail, and lightning. Lasts 1D8+1 rounds. People caught outside must make STR rolls (becoming Hard and Extreme as storm builds) or be blown away (4D6 to 8D6 damage). Lightning strikes on fumbled Luck rolls (1D8 damage).

powers.name: Piercing Cold
powers.description: In snow form, inflicts freezing damage. Lasts 1D8+1 rounds. Each round, unprotected persons take 1D6 damage and lose 2D10 CON. Frostbite requires medical attention.

combat.description: While this avatar does not possess a physical body as such (it being a psychic manifestation), it employs and enhances the weather to attack those in its path.

armor.notes: Possibly may be resisted or banished by the performance of spells. If in snow form, the avatar may be warded off if a significant fire or heat is employed.

deity_entry.name: Kassogtha
deity_entry.description_quote: Cloaked in a halo of ochre-colored light, floats this great mass of blue-tinted and disease-infested coils of flesh, like some conglomeration of intestinal pipes, perhaps miles long, ever moving and sliding, knotting and unknotting in unhealthy rhythm.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: According to some sources, Kassogtha shares some relationship with Great Cthulhu... This Old One seems to be more like some cosmic parasite, able to merge or join with other significant entities for periods of time... When not bound with another entity, Kassogtha appears to dwell in a great body of water (or some such other liquid matter), which is poisoned by its presence. A strong association with disease seems evident... Kassogtha is like a 'cosmic sickness' that seeps into life.

cult.text: Kassogtha has little organized earthly following, seemingly only worshipped by solitary practitioners of magic and those crazed enough to embrace disease as a force for transformation. The (still at large) serial killer known only as the 'Carrion Murderer,' may be an adherent of this Old One. One faction, the Daughters of Isolation, works to undermine and take control of other groups.

possible_blessings.name: Hand of Sickness
possible_blessings.description: Grants an individual immunity to disease while also making them carriers for all manner of earthly and alien sickness.

possible_blessings.name: Language of Pain
possible_blessings.description: The deity forms a psychic link with a follower, forcing them to hear the Old One's messages... causing physical and mental pain.

deity_entry.encounters: Earthly encounters with this Old One are exceedingly rare, with any potential contact most likely arising from cultists or lone adherents.
deity_entry.aura: A pervading disquiet and sense of sickness hang over areas, items, and people touched by Kassogtha. Planet life rots, creatures, and humans present illness.

magic.spells: As the Keeper desires.

powers.name: Poisonous
powers.description: Exudes poisonous gases. 1D4 damage within 10 yards (CON roll). Within 5 yards, Hard CON and 1D4+2 damage. Direct contact requires Extreme CON or 2D4+2 damage.

powers.name: Merge
powers.description: If winning an opposed combined CON and POW roll, may merge with another entity/host. Can force host to supply genetic material for new beings.

combat.description: May strike out and/or grab a target, pulling into its slithering coils.

special_maneuvers.name: Coil Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Target pulled into mass, constricted and crushed. 11D6 damage per round. Escape with Extreme DEX or opposed STR (friends).

armor.notes: Mundane weapons deal minimum damage. If reduced to zero, coils melt and bubble, scorching ground for 100 years. Reforms in 4D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Lilith
deity_entry.description_quote: Beware the sensuous beauty, alabaster skin, and flowing black hair for they hide the leprous and phosphorescent limbs and form of Lilith: this smiling beauty masks a bestial angel of death that shall consume your soul.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: The entity, which some humans have named 'Lilith,' has appeared in a number of forms... Commonly, 'she' appears as a woman of ageless and sinister beauty... At other times, Lilith appears as a glowing leprous figure... A handful of tomes reveal that behind these aspects is a monstrous thing composed of an ovoid shaped body from which six pairs of giant limbs emerge... Some sources believe that Lilith was once a powerful and mysterious Old One who was banished (or escaped) to Earth's Dreamlands and there was reborn as a Great One.

cult.text: Lilith has little organized worship in the modern world, although the deity was well known and feared in the ancient one. Usually, worship centers around small cults and sorcerers... Direct contact with Lilith usually finds her imploring a person to undertake a certain task.

possible_blessings.name: Glamor
possible_blessings.description: Grants the ability to appear beautiful and beguiling to others.

possible_blessings.name: Splendid Dreams
possible_blessings.description: Gathers one or more dreaming people, ferrying their minds into either Earth's Dreamlands or another 'bubble' dreamscape.

deity_entry.encounters: Most encounters are likely to take place in dream... Other times, Lilith may manifest in reality wearing some human-seeming mask... Often, such schemes may be revealed to act against the interests of Nyarlathotep.
deity_entry.aura: Mystery, glamour, and sensuality are often key elements in the appearances of Lilith... A certain sense of tainted beauty may resonate.
deity_entry.sanity_loss: No loss for human guise; 1D4/1D10 for monstrous form.

magic.spells: Awaken the Beast, Bind Enemy, Cloud Memory, Command Animal, Dissolve Skeleton, Drain Youth, Eviscerator, Implant Fear, Raise Corpses, Wrack; others.

powers.name: Beguiling Glamor
powers.description: May appear in human form (usually attractive female). Humans fall into awed stupor if Extreme POW failed.

powers.name: Pass Through
powers.description: Can pass through obstructions. May visit sleeping persons to whisper commands/seduce, draining 1D6+4 MP.

powers.name: Dream Talk
powers.description: May enter and affect human dreams.

powers.name: Kiss
powers.description: Drains 1D6+4 MP by kissing target who fails Extreme POW.

combat.attacks_per_round: 1 (Human: nails, bite, kiss) / 4 (Monstrous: slash, pierce) or 1 (bite)
combat.description: Human: uses claw-like fingernails, bite, or kiss. Monstrous: uses four of its six limbs to slash/pierce or bites.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons during daylight. Regenerates 1 HP per 1 MP. If reduced to zero, crumbles to dust and reforms in 2D8 days in dream.

deity_entry.name: M'guleloc
deity_entry.description_quote: Something like a huge and bloated, coiling mass of entrails, eyes, and worm-like growths, all dripping with bloody ooze and brown-yellow discharges. With every movement it made came a sickening slapping and squelching sound.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Little is known regarding its life or origin, although Volume X of the Revelations of Gla'aki makes mention of M'guleloc, stating it exists 'below the cradle of Gla'aki'. M'guleloc's insatiable hunger drives it to consume and feast on anything in its presence. It seems almost impervious to offensive and warding magic. Some suggest that this entity is more like a magical parasite, attracted to the power utilized in the conjuration of Mythos deities.

cult.text: M'guleloc does not appear to have any human cult. Those who encounter it are liable to be eaten. Given the rarity of its manifestations on this planet, it is possible that alien species on other worlds are aware of, and may worship, this entity.

deity_entry.encounters: It is likely that the entity hijacks the magical summons of others, arriving to eat those involved. The conjuration of M'guleloc may be caused by faulty spellcasting or incorrect spell texts.
deity_entry.aura: Arrival is signaled by strange hissing sounds, followed by a wet squelching that grows louder. Those in the process of spellcasting may note unusual sensations and feel reality-warping.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Magical Immunity
powers.description: Any magic focused at M'guleloc is ineffective unless the wizard achieves a Hard POW roll.

powers.name: Magic Sense
powers.description: Capable of sensing magical 'currents' in the fabric of space-time, such as when employed to summon Mythos beings.

combat.description: Uses worm-like tentacles to strike and grab up to four opponents.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Encircling tentacles hold the target firm and, on the following round, begin to pull, twist, and turn the victim inside out (2D6 damage). M'guleloc then eats the exposed organs (3D6 damage). Escape with Extreme STR or Hard DEX.

armor.notes: Regenerates 5 hit points per magic point spent (death at zero hit points). If reduced to zero, flesh rapidly corrupts into stinking soup. Reforms in 1D10 years.

deity_entry.name: Mh'ithrha
deity_entry.description_quote: Multifaceted features, angular limbs, voids of darkness, and prismatic shapes. Altogether, it took on the aspect of a great wolf, yet seen in multiple viewpoints and shrouded within billowing clouds of purple-black smoke.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: It is written that of all of the Lords of Tindalos, the most powerful is Mh'ithrha. Rarely does this entity remove itself from the nightmare city of Tindalos. Mh'ithrha is a thing composed of multiple angles of flesh, light, and other strange materials. Mh'ithrha has been engaged in an eternal struggle against Yog-Sothoth, apparently vying to destroy and replace Yog-Sothoth as master of time and space.

cult.text: Human cults worshipping Tindalosians are rare. Groups include 'The Chosen of the Blessed Light' and 'The Angled Ones'. Members devise rituals to call Tindalosians to Earth, experimenting with primitive Time Gates.

possible_blessings.name: Hyper-Sight
possible_blessings.description: Grants the ability to see all four dimensions at the cost of 8 magic points and 1D10 Sanity.

possible_blessings.name: Pass Through Angles
possible_blessings.description: Able to travel between points through sharply angled matter (cost 5 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Temporal Ripping
possible_blessings.description: Twists and rips flesh, inflicting variable damage based on MP spent.

deity_entry.encounters: Those traveling by Gates (especially Time Gates) may become caught in space-time eddies. Cults searching for arcane rites to bring Tindalosians to Earth.
deity_entry.aura: Episodes of lost time and/or spatial distortion. Sense of confusion as colors and sounds seem 'wrong'.

magic.spells: Call Lightning, Cloud Memory, Defy Gravity, Drown Mind, Find Gate, Gate, Limbo Gate, Move Gate, Nullify Device, Temporal Rip, Time Gate; others.

powers.name: Charnel Odor
powers.description: All lesser beings within 10 yards/meters must succeed with a Hard CON roll or be incapacitated by nausea for 1D6+1 rounds.

powers.name: Hyper-Sight
powers.description: Able to see an area in four dimensionsall directions, behind obstacles, etc.

powers.name: Step-Through
powers.description: Can step through an angle and travel near instantaneously via hyperspace.

powers.name: Time Jump
powers.description: Costing 30 MP, may cause a section of space to move forward or backward in time.

powers.name: Twist Space
powers.description: Can cause ripples in local space-time. Inside the area, victims see themselves twisted (1/1D4 Sanity loss) and must make Extreme POW or CON or be incapacitated.

combat.description: May attack each target in its immediate vicinity in a round with claws, bite, or tongue. All attacks leave blue ichor.

special_maneuvers.name: Blue Ichor
special_maneuvers.description: Smears poisonous pus that deals 2D6 damage per round until wiped off.

special_maneuvers.name: Bite
special_maneuvers.description: May swallow whole up to SIZ 1,500. Victims disintegrate in 1D10+6 rounds.

special_maneuvers.name: Tongue
special_maneuvers.description: Creates a deep hole-shaped wound. Drains 4D6 points of POW and STR.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Regenerates 8 HP per round. Explodes like glass at 0 HP.

deity_entry.name: Mordiggian
deity_entry.description_quote: A huge and worm-like fetid darkness yet changes shape in an ever-spiraling array of forms... sometimes appearing as an eyeless head upon the limbless form of a demon.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to be worshipped in Zothique in the distant future. Resides in the Dreamlands upon a sea of bones. Manifests deep underground within ghoul-made catacombs. Mordiggian appears unconcerned with humanity, preferring to tender its attention on ghouls. It views humans as a source of nourishment or for transformation into ghouls.

cult.text: Ghouls are the primary followers. The Cult of Mordiggian dates back to the 'Beginning of Days'. Human cults are generally small, often originating within families. In the far future, Mordiggian is the patron deity of Zul-Bha-Sair.

possible_blessings.name: Knowledge Transfer
possible_blessings.description: Assume memories of a deceased person by eating their remains.

possible_blessings.name: Ghoul Sight
possible_blessings.description: See in darkness and enhanced smell.

possible_blessings.name: Transformation
possible_blessings.description: Instantly transformed into a full ghoul.

deity_entry.encounters: Direct encounters are rare but possible in ghoul tunnels or crypts. Ghouls may undertake pilgrimages to bring remains to the Old One.
deity_entry.aura: Death and decay, mystery and secrets. A tangible exercise in body horror.

magic.spells: Animate Flesh Thing, Assist Dreamer, Bring Pestilence, Maggots, Summon Ghouls, Transfer Organ; others.

powers.name: Dizzying Senses
powers.description: Those in presence may be mesmerized/blinded by changing forms (INT+POW roll).

powers.name: Leech Fire
powers.description: All fire and sources of heat/light are extinguished upon arrival.

powers.name: Total Consumption
powers.description: Those eaten are never seen again; life force and soul consumed. Cannot be resurrected.

combat.description: Attacks by engulfing victims, sucking away their life force and dissolving their bodies.

special_maneuvers.name: Engulf
special_maneuvers.description: Target is engulfed if unable to Dodge. Fight back may cause damage but target remains engulfed.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. If reduced to 0 HP, turns into foul-smelling liquid. Reforms in 1D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Mother of Pus
deity_entry.description_quote: Liquescent form lies at the bottom of a stagnant pool, immersed in slime and stinking mud... writhing tentacles rise up to embrace you.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Composed of slime, tentacles, eyes, and mouths. Rumored to be spawned through an obscene rite between a human and an avatar of Shub-Niggurath. Said to dwell at the bottom of a stagnant pool, possibly in the Miskatonic Valley region. It remains in a state of sleep or stasis, able to interact with life in and around the water.

cult.text: No known cult. Locals in Arkham area may be 'touched' and under control.

deity_entry.encounters: Confined to watery home. Encounters outside Miskatonic Valley unlikely.
deity_entry.aura: Sense of otherworldliness, things unclean and unnatural.

magic.spells: Limited, possibly Summon/Bind Dark Young.

powers.name: Nightmares
powers.description: Sends psychic waves within 20 miles. Nightmares cause 1/1D8 Sanity loss.

powers.name: Aberrant Growths
powers.description: Direct contact requires Hard CON/POW or develop growths. Lumps burst after months, causing damage and Sanity loss.

powers.name: Weeping Curse
powers.description: Proximity (10 yards) requires POW roll or struck with weeping sores.

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: Mother of Pus

combat.description: Creates up to six pseudopods to strike or grab.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Victim suffers permanent loss of 1D10 POW (+1 per extra pseudopod) per round. Death at 0 POW.

armor.notes: Mundane weapons deal minimum damage. If reduced to 0 HP, liquifies. Reforms in 2D10 years.

deity_entry.name: Nctosa & Nctolhu
deity_entry.description_quote: Twin daughters of Cthulhu... each much bigger than an ox and looking like some awful beetle or tortoise... colored carapaces protecting them... eight segmented legs... six long arms.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: The Cult of Cthulhu purports that Nctosa and Nctolhu are the twin 'daughters' of Great Cthulhu, born of a union with Kassogtha. They wait, lurking unseen within a 'prison' believed to be located within the Great Red Spot of Jupiter.

cult.text: Cult of Cthulhu venerates them. No other known human cults.

possible_blessings.name: Mind Contact
possible_blessings.description: Those who glimpse them may become mentally linked and forced to do their bidding.

deity_entry.encounters: Human contact is rare, requiring physical journey to Jupiter or mental contact. Cult of Cthulhu may possess rites to contact them.
deity_entry.aura: Profound sense of cosmic wonder and horror.

magic.spells: Contact Cthulhu, Summon/Bind Dimensional Shambler, Summon/Bind Star Vampire.

powers.name: Mental Assault
powers.description: Psychic waves of horror. 1D4/1D8 Sanity loss if Extreme POW failed. Can compel contactee to tasks.

powers.name: Shape Change
powers.description: Nctosa believed able to shapeshift into horrific forms.

combat.description: The twins attack in concert using razor-sharp claws on six long arms. Can shoot green-black goo.

armor.notes: Certain magical weapons may negate armor. If reduced to 0 HP, liquifies. Reforms in 1,000 years.

deity_entry.name: Nodens
deity_entry.description_quote: Conveyed upon a great shell chariot carried on the backs of dolphins, our master shall descend from the heavens. The winds of time shall wend his gray hair and the light of the sun shall make clear his hoary features.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Considered to be part of the order known as Elder Gods. Descriptions describe a wondrous old humanoid being. Some texts suggest Nodens is a force beyond good and evil, whose task is to maintain the 'fabric of life'. Nodens appears to act in opposition to the Great Old Ones and Outer Gods. He takes an imposing human form when appearing to humans. Nodens uses dreams to interact with people.

cult.text: Human cults are rare and small. Some are misguided, considering Nodens a classical god. Enlightened groups comprehend the truth. The Cult of Nodens should be considered neutral.

possible_blessings.name: Higher Perception
possible_blessings.description: Ability to see the world as it truly is, perceiving invisible entities.

possible_blessings.name: Fearless
possible_blessings.description: Immunity to sights of the Mythos (Sanity loss negated or halved).

possible_blessings.name: Dream Link
possible_blessings.description: Power to communicate directly with Nodens' priests in the Dreamlands.

deity_entry.encounters: Those countering cults of Nyarlathotep or Cthulhu may find allies in Nodens worshippers. Most times, the entity does not respond to calls.
deity_entry.aura: Sense of ancient glory or faded history. Sensation of wondrous knowledge just beyond grasp.

magic.spells: Assist Dreamer, Bliss, Cast Out the Devil, Cloud Memory, Elder Sign, and many others.

powers.name: Call Servants
powers.description: Able to summon 1D10 nightgaunts per magic point.

powers.name: Change Form
powers.description: Instantly change form.

powers.name: Dismissal
powers.description: May dismiss other entities (incl. humans), forcing them to retreat.

combat.description: Rarely employs physical attacks, preferring nightgaunts or spells. May strike with hands or unleash bolts of energy.

armor.notes: May create magical armor (1 MP per point). Regenerates 1 HP per 1 MP. If reduced to 0 HP, vanishes. Reforms in 1D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Nug & Yeb
deity_entry.description_quote: Above the one-thousand bridges over the river of the forbidden city of Yian-Ho rises the black sun. Contained within this mighty sphere are Nug and Yeb, the twin monstrosities, ever joined in perpetual union. A bubbling conglomeration of black and gray, formless, twisting, and mixing.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Nug and Yeb are the 'twin offspring' of a union between Yog-Sothoth and Shub-Niggurath, and they are ever-joined together within a black sun that hovers over the city of Yian-Ho believed to exist within the center of the Earth, beyond the world of K'n-yan. Lore tells that these gods will be intertwined until, one day, they become sated and separate, enabling each to fully mature. This event heralds the End Time of the planet.

cult.text: The human-like people of K'n-yan worship Nug and Yeb, holding sickening and horrible orgiastic rites in golden shrines within their underground world. Externally, beyond K'n-yan and in the human world on the planet's surface, worship of these entities is rare.

possible_blessings.name: Join the Sun
possible_blessings.description: K'n-yanian worshippers may be transported into the black sun to momentarily join with their deities; most return severely changed.

deity_entry.encounters: Those finding the secret doors leading to the underground world of K'n-yan may find temples and relics to Nug and Yeb. Those seeking to behold these gods in person must venture through K'n-yan and find the hidden way to Yian-Ho.
deity_entry.aura: Relics tend to be fashioned in Tulu gold. If venturing to Yian-Ho, a person would feel an almost electrical buzz in the air. The black sun occasionally sends forth gouts of black flames.

magic.spells: None (gain spells when separated).

powers.name: Spawn
powers.description: Births horrible creatures (pliable black wads with drooling mouths and numerous mismatched claw or tentacle-like limbs) at will.

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: Nug & Yeb (Identical Profiles)

combat.description: Crushes those who venture too close or sends out gouts of black flame (range 100 yards).

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. If reduced to 0 HP, they shrink and stop moving. Reactivate in 1D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Nyarlathotep
other_names: The God of a Thousand Forms
deity_entry.description_quote: Look unto the skies and see a thousand stars staring down from the cold depths of space... For here are the eyes of Nyarlathotep: one thousand eyes affixed to one thousand forms... It is the music of chaos unbound, unstoppable and all-consuming.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Nyarlathotep is said to possess one thousand forms, each acting independently yet directed by a single will. Scholars speak of this entity as the Messenger of the Outer Gods, the voice of Azathoth, or the soul of the True Gods. Uniquely, Nyarlathotep has distinct 'personalities' and appears to actively interfere in the affairs of humanity, often courting favor to sow chaos and despair.

cult.text: Typically worshiped through one of its avatars. There are numerous such cults spread across the globe (e.g., Brotherhood of the Black Pharaoh, Order of the Bloated Woman, Cult of the Bloody Tongue, Church of Starry Wisdom).

deity_entry.encounters: Nyarlathotep actively interferes with humanity, appearing in human-seeming guises or otherwise. It may take a behind-the-scenes role or take center stage as a trusted friend or leader.
deity_entry.aura: Varies by avatar, but behind the facade lurks a monstrous dark heart. Being 'touched' causes inner revulsion and a growing numbness.

magic.spells: Any the Keeper desires.

powers.name: Animate the Dead
powers.description: Able to animate the dead at a cost of 1 MP per animation within 30 yards.

powers.name: Deadly Touch
powers.description: May cause injury by touching flesh (1D4 damage). Can choose to nullify this.

powers.name: Monster Summons
powers.description: Can summon various Mythos monsters (1 MP per 5 POW of monster).

powers.name: Possession
powers.description: Able to possess zealous believers. Costs 20 MP + 1 per round. Host stats increase: STR/CON/DEX +50, POW becomes 500.

combat.description: Uses multitude of appendages (claws, tentacles) or uses bulk to crush.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Regenerates 2D6 HP per round (death at 0 HP). If 0 HP, shrivels and flies into space.

deity_entry.name: Nyogtha
other_names: The Thing That Should Not Be
deity_entry.description_quote: The painting showed a glistening, gelatinous blob of living darkness... Something like oil given crude shape. Forming out the horrid mass were several rudimentary limbs or pseudopods...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Nyogtha is said to dwell on a dark world near Arcturus and may at times reside on Earth in a deep cavern within Yoth (possibly below Oklahoma). It is believed to have an insatiable appetite, feeding vampirically on the lifeforce of others. Some lore links it to the 'Dweller in Darkness' epithet, confusing it with Nyarlathotep.

cult.text: Few human worshipers; mostly solitary wizards hoping for magical knowledge or vengeance. In the Dreamlands, a ghoul community called the Night Feasters worships Nyogtha.

possible_blessings.name: Odor of Darkness
possible_blessings.description: Worshipper carries the insidious odor of rotting vomit (CON roll to avoid retching).

possible_blessings.name: Living Darkness
possible_blessings.description: Ability to temporarily change into a miniature version of Nyogtha (liquid darkness).

possible_blessings.name: Vampirism
possible_blessings.description: Ability to suck magic points/POW from others via blood.

deity_entry.encounters: Contact with lone practitioners summoning the entity. Search for artifacts like the 'looped cross' (ankh) or Tikkoun Elixir to repel it.
deity_entry.aura: An all-consuming sickness, a rotting smell, and the atmosphere of death. Locations are charnel houses.

magic.spells: Breath of Pazzuzu, Circle of Nausea, Clutch of Nyogtha, Raise Corpses; others.

powers.name: Overwhelming Aura
powers.description: Those within 50 yards must make Extreme CON or suffer penalty die to all actions due to smell/presence.

powers.name: Manipulate Form
powers.description: Can shape a pseudopod to look like a specific person (mockery, not disguise).

combat.description: Strikes all opponents within 10 yards with pseudopods or sends a single one to drain lifeforce.

special_maneuvers.name: Vampiric
special_maneuvers.description: Latches on and sucks blood. 1D10 POW lost per round. Extreme STR to detach or 10 damage to limb.

armor.notes: Ignore first 10 points of damage in a round. If 0 HP, drains into ground. Reforms in 2D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Quachil Uttaus
deity_entry.description_quote: A bizarre humanoid figure of child-like stature, yet bloated and whose flesh was shriveled, warped, and something like a caricature of the most aged specimens of Ancient Egypt's mummies. Its arms were small, each ending in bony claws... the face was featureless except for it being a mass of reticulated wrinkles.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Dwells beyond space and time in a 'limbo' dimension. Said to manipulate time and space and bring about decay, reducing all things to ash. Some associate it with entropy or as an aspect of Azathoth's destructive will. The Testament of Carnamagos contains a ritual to summon it, warning that even reading it may drive one to suicide.

cult.text: The Daughters of Dust is possibly the only true cult, comprised of learned academics seeking secrets of life. Wizards may call upon it for immortality or knowledge.

possible_blessings.name: Pact of Quachil Uttaus
possible_blessings.description: Protection from aging and injury (spine deformed, CON reduced).

possible_blessings.name: Time
possible_blessings.description: Empowering travel through time.

deity_entry.encounters: Rarely visits Earth unless summoned. Summoning involves a shaft of gray light from which the entity slowly descends.
deity_entry.aura: A cloying dryness in the throat, unnatural warmth, mounds of dust, and a haunting smell of the ages.

magic.spells: Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Death's Breath, Drain Youth, Incinerate, Necrosis; others.

powers.name: Entropy
powers.description: All matter touched ages rapidly to dust. Creatures wither and die (1D10 damage/round). Objects within 1 mile age.

powers.name: Manipulate Time/Space
powers.description: Hasten or slow time within 50 yards. Alter physical reality of space.

powers.name: Transfix
powers.description: Targets become transfixed (unable to move) unless Extreme POW roll succeeded (cost 5 MP).

combat.description: Does not engage in combat; approaches slowly to touch target. If not dodged, target ages and dies.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons (they rust/crumble on contact). If 0 HP, turns to dust. Reforms in 24 hours.

deity_entry.name: Rhan-Tegoth
other_names: The Thing on the Ivory Throne
deity_entry.description_quote: At first, we saw the large crab-like pincers emerging, then... six long and sinuous arms or legs. Following these, a fleshy and bulbous... body appeared. Sprouting from atop was a smaller spherical head containing three small eyes... The thin neck pulsed with sickening regularity... the body seemed to be covered in a dense fur... a mass of tiny tendrils.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Originated on Yuggoth, traveling to Earth 3 million years ago. Established domain in Alaska, worshipped by gnoph-keh. Fell into torpor when blood sacrifices ceased. Believed to be the last Old One to 'fall' (hibernate). The Necronomicon suggests it will be among the first to wake. Needs constant feeding to remain awake.

cult.text: Any remnants of pre-human worshippers (gnoph-keh, voormis) are likely hidden in Alaska. Modern idols have been found.

deity_entry.encounters: Archaeological excavations in North America. Discovery of statues.
deity_entry.aura: Not specified in detail, but implied hunger and ancient menace.

magic.spells: N/A

powers.name: Hunger
powers.description: Requires blood sacrifice (20 HP daily) to stay awake. Gains +1D10 HP and 1 CON per 20 HP consumed. If unfed, falls into torpor.

powers.name: Modify Flesh
powers.description: In hibernation, flesh turns stone-like or mummified.

powers.name: Lifeless Dreams
powers.description: Can transmit thoughts/affect dreams while hibernating.

combat.description: Data missing from source.

armor.notes: Data missing from source.

deity_entry.name: Rlim Shaikorth
deity_entry.description_quote: The impression was strong: that of a huge white worm, whose bulbous and segmented flesh was coiled into a blubber pile upon a great dais. The foremost part rose above the coils, with its head seemingly nothing more than a great curved maw, toothless and hollow, although just above that seemed to be two small nostrils and two deep sockets that seemed to constantly form blood-washed orbs, like eyes...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to have come forth to destroy the ancient land of Mhu Thulan in prehistory, Rlim Shaikorth is believed to have fashioned a domain in the cold wastes from where it ruled, sat atop a white dais within a frozen citadel. In time, an unknown calamity caused the citadel and the ice on which it stood to break free and drift upon the oceans of this planet... This floating and un-melting iceberg has become known as Yikilth... Some scholars have associated this Old One with Aphoom Zhah, stating that the former was spawned by the latter.

cult.text: Any human cults revering Rlim Shaikorth appear to have long since died out, with their heyday believed to have been before Hyperborea fell. Some texts comment that in this period, wizards and some mystical sects paid particular attention to this Old One. The same texts often mention the proclivity of Rlim Shaikorth to eat its followers and summoners. It is possible that a form of praise or acknowledgment survives in the hearts and minds of certain seafaring folk.

possible_blessings.name: Cold Hands
possible_blessings.description: The follower is blessed with the ability to produce extreme cold from their hands, able to make objects freeze by touch. Causes 1D6 damage plus the loss of 1D4 CON.

deity_entry.encounters: Those traveling the seas on Earth or in the Dreamlands may hear tales of Yikilth and the frozen god that dwells within. Certain seaports fear the appearance of wintry clouds and storms as heralds of Rlim Shaikorth's approach.
deity_entry.aura: Clearly, anything associated with Rlim Shaikorth carries an unearthly coldness... If encountering Yikilth, the ominous iceberg is preceded by chill winds and freezing mist.

magic.spells: Bloat (variant), Breath of Pazzuzu, Create Mist of R'lyeh, Power Drain, Send Dream, Sirens Song, Wrath of Pazzuzu.

powers.name: Freezing Touch
powers.description: Flesh and objects touched by Rlim Shaikorth freeze solid and never thaw out. Humans suffer 1D10 freezing damage per round, plus loss of 10 CON (Extreme POW to resist).

powers.name: Yikilth
powers.description: The presence of Yikilth causes temperatures to dramatically drop. Extended proximity causes plants, animals, and humans to freeze solid.

powers.name: Lullaby
powers.description: Deep, soft murmuring sounds emitted by the Old One can cause living things to fall into a deep sleep (Extreme CON to resist).

combat.description: Prefers to avoid direct combat, using cold ones to fend off interlopers. Likes to swallow its food whole, often freezing them first.

special_maneuvers.name: Swallow
special_maneuvers.description: If swallowed, a victim has one chance to escape (Jump or Hard DEX). If unsuccessful, they become one with the deity.

special_maneuvers.name: Blood
special_maneuvers.description: Blood is dangerous; those splattered suffer 1D10 damage from freezing burning effect.

armor.notes: If reduced to 0 HP, melts into slurry. Reforms in 4D100 years on Yikilth.

deity_entry.name: Saaitii
deity_entry.description_quote: I saw its pallid snout first, then its immense bulk rising behind like a great hill. As it came into focus, I saw too its tiny, glowing pink-red eyes and its slavering, tusk-filled mouths, for three of these maws it possessed. Upon a dozen or more cloven-hoofed legs it strode, like some monstrous porcine hell beast...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Little is known of Saaitii, otherwise called Sal-Oo-Tep... For some, it is a Lesser Old One, for others a lesser unique being that dwells upon Earth but rarely wakes... While a few believe it to be incorporeal, only taking form on occasion, most think of it as a physical entity that sleeps deep in the ground, only rising at specific times. The Sgsand Manuscript suggests that Saaitii was from 'without' and came to this planet to 'take form,' and thereby chose a form inspired by hogs.

cult.text: While no overarching organized human cult exists, it would be true to say that there are some groups and communities that venerate the hog god Saaitii. Such people tend to hold Saaitii either in solo devotion or within a small pantheon of 'earth spirits.'... A few may have formed a stronger, direct connection to the entity... These latter groups are likely to be far more dangerous and given to holding blood sacrifices.

possible_blessings.name: Hog Form
possible_blessings.description: Able to physically transform into a hog-like creature.

possible_blessings.name: Possess Hog
possible_blessings.description: Grants the cultist the ability to mind swap with a hog.

possible_blessings.name: Tusks
possible_blessings.description: High priests may find tusks growing from their mouths (dealing 1D6+DB damage).

deity_entry.encounters: Those in remote areas, particularly within temperate climes, may uncover evidence of the worship of Saaitii... Direct encounters with Saaitii are possible, should the entity be summoned, somehow unearthed deep in the ground while it sleeps, or called to temporarily run free and feed.
deity_entry.aura: A cloying earthiness surrounds this entity as well as the aura of a predatorbestial, threatening, and hungry. A growing feeling of loathing may build... The air tingles with expectation.

magic.spells: Cloud Memory, Enthrall Victim, Implant Fear, Mental Suggestion, Mindblast.

powers.name: Dream Sending
powers.description: Can send mind to find and target a person within 5 miles. Link causes horrible dreams of hellish labyrinths and squealing swine. Dreams cause 1/1D4 Sanity loss.

powers.name: Mind Control
powers.description: Psychically takes control of a person within 50 yards (Extreme POW to resist). Controlled for 2D10+4 hours. May take victims to lair to be psychically consumed (2D10 POW/day).

powers.name: Possession
powers.description: When manifesting, possesses the nearest animal or human, twisting flesh to create a swine-like horror.

combat.description: May use its mouths to bite and tusks to gore and tear up to twice per round, or may charge and trample.

armor.notes: If reduced to 0 HP, collapses and splits open. Reforms in 100 years.

deity_entry.name: Sebek
deity_entry.description_quote: In reality, it appears some ten feet high; its humanoid torso upon two legs, its long and rope-like arms ending with clawed hands of sharp talons. A slanted head, crocodilian in aspect but somehow more reminiscent of a great lizard or dragon. The flesh was not human, but rather a lattice of irregular scales of differing green hues...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: While many texts consider Sebek to be a Lesser Old One it is understood by some that this entity may be related to or is mutation of the lloigor race... Sebek appears to have been mistaken or considered to be a characterized form of Sobek, the crocodile-headed god of the Ancient Egyptian pantheon... It seems clear that Sebek may have used such misconceptions to effectively infiltrate humanity's perceptions and beliefs... Sebek's physical manifestation is subtler and more cunning in that it has fashioned its appearance (on Earth at least) upon a cross of human and crocodile.

cult.text: The ancient Cult of Sebek believed their god to be a source of infinite life and pathway to immortality. The priesthood of the cult taught that their god would bring resurrection at an appointed time. The priesthood is believed to have placed curses upon their tombs.

possible_blessings.name: Resurrection
possible_blessings.description: May restore a lesser being to life (10 MP). Immortality for 5 extra MP.

possible_blessings.name: Telekinesis
possible_blessings.description: Can manipulate matter within 60 yards (5 MP for STR 10 force).

deity_entry.encounters: Chance sightings are rare as Sebek departed the planet. Manifestations might occur if a food source fails elsewhere or through summons.
deity_entry.aura: Not detailed, but implies cunning and ancient power.

magic.spells: Contact Lloigor, Dominate, Dread Curse of Azathoth, Mental Suggestion.

powers.name: Resurrection
powers.description: Restores life/grants immortality (see Blessings).

powers.name: Telekinesis
powers.description: Manipulate matter at distance.

combat.description: Incorporeal: mental powers/vortex. Physical: claws to strike/rend, or bite.

special_maneuvers.name: Vortex Attack
special_maneuvers.description: Implosion blast tearing things to pieces. 20 MP for 5 yard area (1D100 damage).

armor.notes: Incorporeal form immune to mundane weapons. Regenerates 1 HP per 1 MP. If 0 HP, turns to dust (physical) or wave of cold (incorporeal). Reforms in 1,000 years.

deity_entry.name: Shub-Niggurath
other_names: The Black Goat of the Woods with a Thousand Young
deity_entry.description_quote: A huge, floating mass of dark cancerous flesh on which grew countless boil-like growths, some of which formed into eyes, while others parted to reveal mouths of shark-like teeth. From this ever-festering flesh extended horrifying limbs... Some were tentacular... while others seemed to end cloven hooves. All the time, great gouts of slime sloughed off...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Perhaps, upon Earth, one of the most worshipped deities of all the cosmic pantheon. Some texts suggest this entity may at times reside within the planet Yaddith... although many believe Shub-Niggurath's true domain exists in another dimension, often called Sekrem. Shub-Niggurath's appearances on Earth have caused humanity to conjure meaning and definition... often misinterpreting the entity as the manifestation of gods such as Cybele, Gaia, Pan, and so on... Most scholars agree that Shub-Niggurath is like a creator aspect of the cosmos, perhaps even an embodiment of Azathoth as creator. Yet, unchecked, such creation is overly abundant, choking, and self-consuming.

cult.text: Human cults worshipping Shub-Niggurath have existed for millennia... its worship has often been disguised through prayers and devotions to simplistic earthly gods... Thus, some who might present themselves as witches, druids, or pagans, may be devoted to the Dark Mother. The full moon seems to hold particular relevance... One particularly insidious cult, named The End, sees Shub-Niggurath as a form of perfection.

possible_blessings.name: Become Child of Shub-Niggurath
possible_blessings.description: Transformed into a Child of Shub-Niggurath.

possible_blessings.name: Mutation
possible_blessings.description: Blessed with physical mutations like cloven hooves, extra arms, or heads.

possible_blessings.name: Mind Swap
possible_blessings.description: Mind transferred into a dark young.

possible_blessings.name: Command Animal/Plant
possible_blessings.description: Give simple commands to nature.

possible_blessings.name: Increase
possible_blessings.description: Expand physicality by spending 10 MP to double SIZ and STR for 1D4 hours.

deity_entry.encounters: Many human magical practices have their roots in the worship of the Dark Mother... While contact with the deity remains possible, most will come to know Shub-Niggurath through the varied and disparate cults. Those infiltrating mi-go outposts... may come upon alien temples.
deity_entry.aura: Heady mix of organic smells and sounds. Smell of blood. Feeling of constriction. Living matter touched by the deity is twisted and mutated.

magic.spells: Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Call Lightning, Clutch of Nyogtha, Command Animal, Command Plants, Curse, Healing (variant), Human Shrub, Maggots, The Red Sign, Wrack; others.

powers.name: Body Modification
powers.description: Form is not fixed; warps mass at will. Typically a cloud with eyes/mouths/limbs, or multilegged lizard-spider-like thing.

powers.name: Create Servitors
powers.description: Births dark young and other horrors at will.

powers.name: Mother's Milk
powers.description: Milk causes transformations/mutations. May turn human into Child of Shub-Niggurath.

combat.description: Uses multitude of tentacles/limbs or tramples.

special_maneuvers.name: Seize
special_maneuvers.description: Victim gathered into body and drained of fluids (3D10 STR permanent loss/round). Helpless while draining. Escape with Extreme STR/DEX on next action only.

special_maneuvers.name: Trample
special_maneuvers.description: Tramples beings SIZ 300 or less within 20 yards. Extreme Dodge to avoid 11D6 damage.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Regenerates 2 HP per 1 MP. If 0 HP, petrifies and shatters; reforms in 1D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Shub-Niggurath: The Great God Pan
deity_entry.description_quote: Beware the root, twig, and leaf... Many aspects can it take, but most well-known is the cloven hoofed one, the man-goat wreathed in green, whose devil eyes are those of the ram upon the field.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Believed to be a 'male' aspect of Shub-Niggurath... The satyr form is humanoid, with a human-like muscular torso, arms, and head, while its legs and feet are goat-like. Its eyes are inhuman... Much like the Lady of the Woods, the Great God Pan is a conduit for reckless desire, yet a far less subtle one... manifesting in excessive and cruel violence, immorality, and nature untamed.

cult.text: There appears to be no organized human cult... isolated groups do devote worship to the Dark Mother in the form of this entity. Such cults, like the Green Hand, the Brotherhood of Oak, and the Dirt Eaters, tend to be fanatical and highly committed to breaking down societal norms.

deity_entry.encounters: Deep woods, ancient forests. Rumors of 'Wild Men'.
deity_entry.aura: Overwhelming panic and fear (panic) or reckless abandon.

magic.spells: Cause/Cure Blindness, Command Animal, Command Plant, Create Charm, Pipes of Madness.

powers.name: Maddening Music
powers.description: Music overwhelms with fear/panic (Sanity roll 0/1D8). Fumble requires CON roll or heart attack.

powers.name: Beguiling Music
powers.description: Music charms listeners (POW roll). Failure causes dancing until exhaustion. Fumble causes enslavement.

powers.name: Manipulate Nature
powers.description: Warps/mutates animal and plant life nearby.

powers.name: Wild Abandon
powers.description: Humans within 10 yards driven to wild abandon/violence (Hard POW negates).

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: Great God Pan

combat.description: Fights with hooves, fists, or simple weapons.

armor.notes: Regenerates 2 HP per round. If 0 HP, vanishes.

deity_entry.name: Shub-Niggurath: The Lady of the Woods
deity_entry.description_quote: She stepped from the tree as though she were made of wood and leaf, her skin like bark and her hair a crown of autumnal glory. Beautiful and terrible, she radiated a warmth that was both comforting and burning.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Whether male, female, or androgynous, this avatar tends to appear particularly attractive, usually tall, elegant or rakish, and confident... Humans meeting this avatar instinctively know this 'person' is a personification of fire, excess, and extremes... Thus, humans can fall easily for the Lady/Man of the Woods... It would seem that this avatar mostly manifests when Shub-Niggurath has been unsuccessfully summoned... with the avatar appearing to manipulate the local inhabitants into a frenzy of creativity and hedonism that usually ends in wanton destruction.

cult.text: No overarching and long-lived human cult exists... The Red Sisterhood, the Burning Hearts, and the Daughters of Blood are just three cults worshipping the Lady of the Woods.

possible_blessings.name: Beguile
possible_blessings.description: Grants ability to magically charm another person (opposed POW).

possible_blessings.name: Enhanced Appearance
possible_blessings.description: Reshapes follower's face/form, increasing APP to 80+1D10.

possible_blessings.name: Know the Forest
possible_blessings.description: Ability to navigate woodland and use vegetation for concealment.

deity_entry.encounters: Those traveling alone through a wilderness may come upon the Lady of the Woods... Encounters may lead to madness, death, or strange blessings.
deity_entry.aura: Seductive and overwhelming warmth/charisma.

magic.spells: Charm, Command Animal, Dominate, Fascinate, Implant Fear.

powers.name: Command
powers.description: Humans fall under command when spoken to (Extreme POW to negate). Can work at distance with reduced difficulty.

powers.name: Wild Abandon
powers.description: Humans within sight/sound driven to acts of wild abandon/violence. Hard POW negates.

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: Lady of the Woods

combat.description: Usually does not fight, using magic/minions. If pressed, uses nature or weapons.

armor.notes: If 0 HP, dissolves into leaves/twigs. Reforms elsewhere.

deity_entry.name: Shudde M'ell
deity_entry.description_quote: The air stank with the smell of corrosion, acid, and death. It was immense, extending into the distance, perhaps a mile long and as tall as a tree. Its flesh was like rock, dark gray and pitted, its form a hybrid nightmare of worm-snake-squid. At one end, perhaps its head, bundles of tentacles emerged... Many of these tentacles possessed spikes (teeth?)... About the base of the tentacles, the skin rolled back to reveal huge saucer-like eyes...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Believed to be the god of the chthonians, Shudde M'ell is said to be a monstrously large specimen of that race... The G'harne Fragments of Sir Amery Wendy-Smith... reports that this entity stretches over a mile in length but otherwise is more or less of similar aspect to a chthonian... Shudde M'ell and its kin were encased below the fabled city of G'harne (Africa?)... Shudde M'ell is believed to remain ensconced at the Earth's core... Some have claimed that certain significant seismic events were caused by the movement of this entity...

cult.text: Shudde M'ell and the chthonians appear to receive little by the way of organized worship in modern times... The construction of G'harne was believed to have been undertaken by humans... Of a disquieting note, mentioned in G'harne Fragments, is a remark concerning a 'tribe of worm-men' said to still dwell in the now-hidden city.

deity_entry.encounters: Those delving into the secrets of G'harne, perhaps seeking the fabled golden idol of Shudde M'ell, may come across cultists, worm-folk, and other horrors... Likewise, exploration of the subterranean worlds below the crust... may come across signs of this Old One's worship.
deity_entry.aura: Given the fact that a manifestation of Shudde M'ell will come upward from the center of the planet, it would be prudent to consider where one stands lest all be swallowed... Toxic gases and noxious fumes from its acid-like sweat may cause humans to become nauseous and the ambient temperature to rise.

magic.spells: Bait Human, Bring Haboob, Contact Chthonian, The Red Sign; others as the Keeper desires.

powers.name: Cause Earthquake
powers.description: Force determined by MP invested (2 MP = Level 1 Richter, 18 MP = Level 9). Max area 400 yards/meters.

powers.name: Corrosion and Toxicity
powers.description: Flesh releases noxious fumes (Hard CON or nausea within 20 yards). Touching flesh causes 1 damage/round (1D4+2 if thrown against). Burns through clothing/equipment.

powers.name: Hell Hole
powers.description: Creates a hole 1D10+10 yards wide from below. Anything over it is sucked down (10D10 damage).

powers.name: Telepathic Control
powers.description: Can control humans/others. Hard POW to resist (Extreme if 1 MP spent). Can contact known humans anywhere.

combat.description: Uses tentacles to bash or grab, or bulk to smash.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Tentacle wraps target. Next round crushes (6D6) or drains fluids (3D10 CON permanent/round). Escape with Extreme STR or Hard DEX.

special_maneuvers.name: Smash
special_maneuvers.description: Crushes foes in 12 yard/meter diameter area (12D6 damage).

armor.notes: Mundane weapons destroyed after first strike. Regenerates 5 HP per 1 MP. Water causes harm (1D6/round). If 0 HP, dissolves. Reforms in 1,000 years.

deity_entry.name: Tru'nembra
deity_entry.description_quote: The music filled the air... the tempo increased and became a volatile and unpredictable capriccioso. The sounds grew discordant... a deep and pounding rhythm could be heard... The sounds confounded the senses, caused the floorboard and walls to tremble...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: A curious and strange entity believed to possess no form and exist purely as living sound. According to the Necronomicon, Tru'nembra is chief among those whose sounds maintain the sleep of Azathoth by creating the Music of the Spheres... While most scholars claim it never leaves Azathoth's Court, a few have claimed to have discovered evidence suggesting that... it may temporarily take leave to manifest elsewhere... Certain scraps of musical notations have been produced... but such performances have tended to end in disaster...

cult.text: There appears to be no overarching and formalized cult of Tru'nembra. It would seem that worshippers are usually solo players, isolated and reclusive types... Often, such individuals are musical geniuses... Once hooked by this entity's sounds, a person either comes to worship it or descends into madness, or both.

possible_blessings.name: Inspiring Melodies
possible_blessings.description: Bestows new depths of musical knowledge... Such melodies may cause changes in listeners (violence, insight, etc.).

possible_blessings.name: Wake the Dead
possible_blessings.description: Ability to perform music that wakes the dead.

possible_blessings.name: Sound Magic
possible_blessings.description: Grants ability to cast spells through music.

deity_entry.encounters: Musical prodigies may attract the attention of Tru'nembra... Some may be driven to craft unusual musical instruments... As each day passes, the prodigy's mind is corrupted... Some may become so consumed that the music transforms them into horrific creatures...
deity_entry.aura: Sound clearly plays a key role... The mind is filled with outr haunting music that washes away the distractions of everyday life. Such sounds may kill or transform... The entity's presence... may be felt as tremors in the air.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Symphonic Manifestation
powers.description: Constant music. Heard up to 5 miles away. Sanity loss varies by distance (0/1D4 to 1D4/2D10).

powers.name: Sonic Wave
powers.description: Sends forth damaging sound (damage based on MP spent, 1 MP = 1 die). Affects all within 100 yards. 100 MP causes 1D100 damage and structural destruction.

powers.name: Speed of Sound
powers.description: Able to move at the speed of sound.

combat.description: May send forth a Sonic Wave once per round.

armor.notes: Immune to physical attacks (incl. enchanted). Artifacts/spells/music may harm. If 0 HP, music ceases. Reforms in 24 hours.

deity_entry.name: Tsathoggua
