deity_entry.description_quote: Before us was the formless mass of its body on which lolled the awful toad-like head. Its bulk was immense and covered in a glistening brownish fur... Two legs and two arms sprouted from the fleshy mass... Dire was its face, which possessed eye slits... and the great mouth... opening to display layers of crooked and sharp teeth and a huge and repulsive tongue.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Contradictory accounts suggest this entity originated within the light of Xoth... Consensus seems to be reached concerning Tsathoggua's contemporary whereabouts: said to be within the black gulfs of hidden N'kai deep within the Earth... Most accounts proffer that Tsathoggua is a slothful entity... preferring to remain deep within the bowels of the planet and rarely venturing physically forth.

cult.text: Human worship of Tsathoggua is relatively small scale... often a cult will form and begin a rapid phase of growth... and then disappear without a trace... Among the voormis still living are many who tend to Tsathoggua... It is among the serpent people where this Old One's worship is most formalized and organized.

possible_blessings.name: Divine Physicality
possible_blessings.description: Blessed with physical changes (furry skin, toad head, etc.).

possible_blessings.name: Mark of Tsathoggua
possible_blessings.description: Burned into skin, showing favor. Often grants psychic link.

possible_blessings.name: Doorway to Divinity
possible_blessings.description: Grants Gate spell to Tsathoggua's lair (2 MP to create, 1 MP/1 SAN to use).

deity_entry.encounters: Many forgotten and hidden temples to Tsathoggua exist... most are guarded by at least one formless spawn... Those investigating the machinations of the serpent people may unexpectedly find they are facing worshippers of Tsathoggua...
deity_entry.aura: The smell of death would be strong. The dust of millennia-old bones chokes the air while the decaying rot of partially eaten sacrifices lingers...

magic.spells: Animate Flesh Thing, Chasm to Hell, Compel Flesh, Dho Formula, Dominate, Grasp of Cthulhu, Mindblast, Send Dream, Sense Life, Wrack; others.

powers.name: Coterie
powers.description: Accompanied by 1D4 formless spawn.

powers.name: Implant Desire
powers.description: Idols compel humans to seek the Old One (POW roll).

powers.name: Psychic Form
powers.description: Sends semi-material projection (0/1D10 SAN). Can interact for 10 MP/round.

powers.name: Shapeshift
powers.description: Change shape for 10 MP.

powers.name: Sleeping Hunger
powers.description: May feed while asleep (Luck roll to target nearby).

combat.description: Uses limbs/tongue to attack.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Grabs target. Next round squeezes (3D6) or bites (3D6). May swallow.

special_maneuvers.name: Swallow
special_maneuvers.description: Gobbles target. 1D6 damage first round, then 5 CON/APP per round. Escape requires 10 damage or making self indigestible.

special_maneuvers.name: Crush
special_maneuvers.description: Rolls/hops on foes (4D6 damage).

armor.notes: Regenerates 30 HP/round. If 0 HP, melts into viscid matter. Reforms in 1,000 years.

deity_entry.name: Tulzscha
deity_entry.description_quote: It burst from the ground, a noxious blaze of green flame and light... Casting no shadows and releasing no heat, just an icy cold, this unearthly fire kissed the ground...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: An unusual entity seemingly composed of living flame that burns a green-blue color... The Necronomicon makes mention of a Green Flame (which most assume to be Tulzscha) that dances around sleeping Azathoth... Tulzscha seems to feed upon or be invigorated by death and decay... Accounts of its visitations on this planet are rare...

cult.text: Organized human cults dedicated to Tulzscha are rare... Seemingly, most of these cults and practitioners gather in subterranean chambers... Some ghouls pay respect to this Outer God... While many believe the Kingsport cult to have died out around 200 years ago, the reports of more recent gatherings suggest this is either false or misinformation...

possible_blessings.name: Flaming Truth
possible_blessings.description: Detect lies (5 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Possessing Fire
possible_blessings.description: Creates green flame to hold individual (3 MP).

possible_blessings.name: Knowledge of Corruption
possible_blessings.description: Eat flesh to gain memories/spells.

deity_entry.encounters: Encounters with Tulzscha are rare and most likely to come via its cultists or in the shape of those possessed by a portion of the Outer God... Ghouls worshipping Tulzscha may be at odds with others of their kind...
deity_entry.aura: Most times, any encounters are liable to be connected to places of death and decay. Tulzscha's flames are cold, causing the temperature to drop... The pervading atmosphere is clammy despite the cold...

magic.spells: Animate Flesh Thing, Augury (variant), Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Call Forth the Worm, Contact Ghoul, Contact Human (variant), Death's Breath (variant), Embrace of Yog-Sothoth, Touch of Decay; others.

powers.name: Enchant Item
powers.description: Items passed through flames imbued with magical properties.

powers.name: Entrancing Fire
powers.description: Captivates humans (Hard POW) until damaged or god departs.

powers.name: Malleable Form
powers.description: Can reshape flames. Immobile when summoned (free in space).

powers.name: Noxious
powers.description: Emits fumes (1D4 damage within 5 yards, 1 MP).

powers.name: Possession
powers.description: Shoots splinter into being (Hard POW to resist). Victim rots away in 1D6 weeks.

combat.description: Sends forth flaming tendrils (10 yards) or flame gout. Contact causes 1D6+2 cold burn.

special_maneuvers.name: Flame Gout
special_maneuvers.description: 3 MP. 15 yard range. 2D10 years aging + 2D10 APP/CON/POW loss.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons, heat, cold, acid, electricity. Explosives min damage. If 0 HP, implodes to crystal ball. Reforms in 1D100 hours.

deity_entry.name: Ubbo-Sathla
deity_entry.description_quote: For it is the source of all life! The formless jelloid mass, without limbs or organs yet able to produce organs and limbs at will... It lives! See how the fleshy substance quivers and ripples... See its many brood flow from its body!
deity_entry.main_entry_text: A seemingly mindless entity composed of jelly-like liquid the consistency of thick mud... Certain scholars... state that Ubbo-Sathla was brought to Earth by the Old Ones... Others propose that Ubbo-Sathla was, in fact, the creation of the elder things... Ubbo-Sathla's whereabouts are equally confusing... What is agreed upon is that Ubbo-Sathla was the guardian of the Tablets of Life...

cult.text: No human cult is believed to exist, although both the mi-go and the sand-dwellers are said to hold Ubbo-Sathla in their devotions.

deity_entry.encounters: It remains an outside possibility for humans to encounter Ubbo-Sathla... Those desirous of investigating pre-history and the work of the elder things may run into mentions... Seekers of the Tablets of Life may too uncover tales...
deity_entry.aura: For those reaching Ubbo-Sathla's lair, this grotto may be something of a nightmare plain in which millions of strange and exotic lifeforms are birthed...

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Brood of Ubbo-Sathla
powers.description: Produces 1D10 offspring per round.

powers.name: Leech Touch
powers.description: Touches leech lifeforce (1D6 damage/round).

powers.name: Unintelligent
powers.description: Insentient/primal. Attacks if threatened or randomly.

combat.description: Lashes or grabs with pseudopods. Strike damage random 1D4 to 15D6.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Held (1D6 damage). Next round squeeze (7D6) or absorb (15D6). Escape with Extreme STR or Hard DEX.

armor.notes: Impaling weapons min damage. Regenerates 25 HP/round. If 0 HP, liquifies. Reforms in 4D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Ut'ulls-Hr'her
deity_entry.description_quote: I saw its scale-covered ovoid body and the crescent-shaped head that rose above it possessed of a beard of horn-like growths... Above these horns, no mouth nor eyes could be discerned... Amidst the lower torso were clumps of teats surrounded by small fish-like fins.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Much remains to be learned concerning this little-known entity... The majority class Ut'ulls-Hr'her as a Great Old One... said to dwell in the vicinity of Mira... Some regard Ut'ulls-Hr'her as an avatar of Shub-Niggurath... Much like the Dark Mother, the 'milk' said to be produced by Ut'ulls-Hr'her is claimed to have astounding properties...

cult.text: Seemingly, a number of earthly cults have changed their allegiances after unwittingly calling Ut'ulls-Hr'her... One faction of the cult, the Daughters of Isolation, has come to the foreground...

possible_blessings.name: Milk of the Mother
possible_blessings.description: Drinking milk heals and grants visions (Cthulhu Mythos). Side effect: flesh corruption/mutation.

possible_blessings.name: Horned
possible_blessings.description: Grow horns (1D4/1D6 damage).

deity_entry.encounters: Encounters are likely linked to the Daughters of Isolation or miscast summonings.
deity_entry.aura: Sickly sweet smell, sense of nausea. Feelings of insignificance.

magic.spells: Any.

powers.name: Milk
powers.description: Produced from teats. Healing/Visions but causes mutation.

powers.name: Scream
powers.description: Sonic blast (1D6 damage + deafness).

combat.description: Attacks with horns/tentacles or crushes.

special_maneuvers.name: Crush
special_maneuvers.description: Rolls over targets (5D6 damage).

armor.notes: Regenerates 5 HP/round. If 0 HP, dissolves. Reforms in 100 years.

deity_entry.name: Vulthoom
deity_entry.description_quote: For it is made of many strands, twisting and curling around one another like a plant's vines and roots. These limbs are swollen and bloated at points... The strands grow thicker as they weave together, forming a rounded bulb-like mass... Atop this spherical body... is a great vermillion cup-like orifice, as though a flower bursting forth...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Said to be a plant-like entity... better to describe it as a combination of vegetable and flesh... some scholars agree that there are layers or portions of it that exist only in higher dimensions... According to some, Vulthoom was begat by Yog-Sothoth, while others allege this Old One is the fruit of Shub-Niggurath... In prehistory, this entity was said to have arrived on Mars, where it 'took root' and had dominance over the Aihais... Vulthoom rests below the surface of Mars in the subterranean ghost city of Ravormos... A frightening prospect is the notion that Vulthoom may be able to reproduce itself via seed-like pods, which it is believed to cast out once every 10,000 years.

cult.text: The Martian Aihais worship of Vulthoom is considered to be dead... Beyond Mars, no organized cults (human or otherwise) appear to exist. Should the accounts of the wizard Sunda-lon fall into the wrong hands, one might suppose a knowledge of this Old One could inspire some to take up its worship.

possible_blessings.name: Seed of Vulthoom
possible_blessings.description: Possession of a seed pod which, if allowed to grow, could become connected to the deity's will. As the seed grows, it may release pheromones bestowing unusual abilities.

deity_entry.encounters: Interplanetary explorers arriving on Mars and delving below the Red Planet's surface may discover the ancient tunnels of the Aihasi... leading to Ravormos. More possible may be the discovery of an ancient seed pod cast out by the entity... allowing Vulthoom to move all or part of its consciousness to Earth.
deity_entry.aura: Appearing to be vegetable matter reveals itself to be a lifeform possessing cold intelligence and a terrifying hunger. Those in proximity... are liable to be affected by the entity's pheromones.

magic.spells: Specialsee Powers.

powers.name: Great Sight
powers.description: Possesses the ability to extend its perception over great distances of space and time.

powers.name: Mellifluous Voice
powers.description: Voice is incredibly sweet and sonorous... fostering goodwill in those hearing it unless they resist with a Hard POW roll.

powers.name: Pheromones
powers.description: Releases pheromones causing spell-like effects (Cloud Memory, Command Animal, Dominate, Implant Fear, etc.). Effects diminish with distance. Cost 5 MP.

powers.name: Hallucinogenic Fragrance
powers.description: Produces a sweet scent. Inhaling requires POW roll or experience vivid hallucinations. Fumble enslaves victim.

combat.description: May send forth its vine/root tendrils to strike or grab. Tends to rely upon its powers to use others to defend itself.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Target is held and then strangled (1D6 damage/round) or pulled into mass to be crushed (6D6 damage).

armor.notes: Mundane weapons (incl. bullets) deal minimum damage. Regenerates 2 HP per 1 MP. If 0 HP, withers to husk; regrows in 5D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Y'golonac
deity_entry.description_quote: Our Lord made manifest, stood some ten to twelve feet high, towering and naked before us. The flesh was slick with sweat and blood as it raised its arms to reveal distended hands, the palms of which possessed slit-mouths containing sharp teeth and rolling bloody tongues. There was no head, just the bloated bulk...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Y'golonac's earthly manifestations present the entity as human-like in appearance (although possessing no head)... Speculation is that this deity is greatly connected to this planet and... imprisoned here within a walled-off chamber connected to a subterranean network of tunnels... below the Severn Valley city of Brichester. Y'golonac appears to exude and foster a moral decline in those it influences... preying on people at the fringes of society who easily absorb its demented and appalling creed. Unlike most others of its kind, the summoning of Y'golonac appears to be a simple (but horrifying) affair, with the summoner just required to read aloud the correct pronunciation of the name 'Y'golonac'.

cult.text: Y'golonac's brood is plentiful... These small creatives appear as deformed humanoids... Sometimes naked, sometimes cloaked in dirty and tattered rags... Most believe both Y'golonac and its servants are bound and imprisoned... Cults are often small, localized, and heavily involved in perversion and debauchery.

possible_blessings.name: Corrupting Influence
possible_blessings.description: Exposure to whispers for several days causes corruption. Countered by daily POW roll. Failure leads to consumption by vice and loss of Sanity.

deity_entry.encounters: Reading forbidden texts (Revelations of Gla'aki), speaking the name, or entering the tunnels below Brichester. Often offered a choice: accept Y'golonac as master or be destroyed.
deity_entry.aura: Sickly sweet smell of rotting fruit and sweat. A profound sense of dirtiness and shame.
deity_entry.sanity_loss: 1/2D10 to witness manifestation through possession; 1/1D10+1 for human-like form; 1D6/4D10 for true form.

magic.spells: Animate Flesh Thing, Circle of Nausea, Cloud Memory, Dominate, Grasp of Cthulhu, Mental Suggestion, Send Dream, Utterance of Bile; others.

powers.name: Possession
powers.description: If a person consumes a portion of Y'golonac's flesh (or summons it), the Old One may take possession (Extreme POW to resist). Flesh corrupts over 7 days into the headless horror form.

powers.name: Growth
powers.description: For every 100 points of SIZ consumed, increases SIZ by 1 point.

combat.description: Uses great hands or body to smash and crush, or may attempt to eat opponents.

special_maneuvers.name: Eat
special_maneuvers.description: Bites and chews for 3D6 damage. If reduced to zero hit points, victim is swallowed.

armor.notes: Regenerates 1 HP per 10 points of SIZ consumed. If 0 HP, explodes in shower of offal. Reforms in 5D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Yibb-Tstll
deity_entry.description_quote: I saw its enormous cloak open to reveal its glistening body... Its ovoid body sprouting hundreds of pendulous teats upon which a horde of 'gaunts supped upon its black milk. Betwixt were reams of curling tentacles... while its head sat atopa hideous mess of animated flesh...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Yibb-Tstll causes great debate... considered a Great Old One by some, an Outer God by others... Said to watch over all things, Yibb-Tstll appears to some to be an immobile register of the cosmos... Others say it is a parasite-like creature that ventures forth occasionally to feast upon the blood of other cosmic beings... Yibb-Tstll appears to dwell in Earth's Dreamlands, apparently upon an unknown mountain beyond the Jungle of Kled... The entity's blood is believed to be semi-conscious or intelligent... known as the Black Milk or The Black.

cult.text: No remnants of ancient cults believed to exist. Most significant surviving cult is the Cult of Chuma in Africa/Near East. Solo practitioners use dreams/magic to commune.

possible_blessings.name: The Black Milk
possible_blessings.description: Ingesting a portion allows direct communication and sharing of thoughts.

possible_blessings.name: Cosmic Wisdom
possible_blessings.description: Transference of knowledge (magic, events, Cthulhu Mythos skill).

possible_blessings.name: Faceless Servant
possible_blessings.description: Nightgaunt gifted to worshipper.

deity_entry.encounters: Delving through forbidden tomes. Seeking answers via dream. Caught in warring wizards using The Black.
deity_entry.aura: Nasty and sickly. Nightgaunts associated with it smell different. Pull-push reaction of temptation and revulsion.

magic.spells: Ariadne's Twine, Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Contact Moon-Beast, Dominate, Explode Heart, Hunger of Kazan, Living Clothes, Summon/Bind Nightgaunt, The Ravening Madness; others.

powers.name: The Black
powers.description: Blood forms a barrier or attacks. Flakes off to smother victims (suffocation/damage). Can possess victims (opposed POW).

powers.name: Touch of Wisdom
powers.description: Touch causes instant realization of cosmic reality. 1D10/1D100 Sanity loss. 1D10 Cthulhu Mythos gain.

powers.name: Great Wisdom
powers.description: Grant insight to those who sup Black Milk.

powers.name: Nightgaunts
powers.description: Accompanied by 1D100+10 nightgaunts.

combat.description: Lashes out with tentacles or casts The Black.

special_maneuvers.name: The Black
special_maneuvers.description: Blood flakes off to attack. Can smother (suffocation damage) or possess.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Regenerates 5 HP/round. If 0 HP, dissolves into pool of black blood. Reforms in 1D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Yidhra
deity_entry.description_quote: Know Yidhra through the comely forms that disguise the corruption within, which no man can look upon and live.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: It is said that Yidhra has been on Earth since the first life appeared... Over millennia, this entity grew and developed, learning to mimic earthly lifeforms by consumption... Yidhra self-divided itself, causing portions of itself to break free and assume separate and independent forms (avatars)... Yidhra constantly evolves and changes... It has been a constant need to consume fresh genetic material... Numerous texts... describe Yidhra in varying human or monstrous guises... Three most well-documented forms are Madam Yi, Y'hath, and Yolanda.

cult.text: Numerous groups and cults have come to worship Yidhra's differing forms over time... True followers... are often blessed with long (possibly immortal) lives, with almost all appearing to possess fangs... For a few followers, Yidhra may reveal its true form... This latter group is sometimes called the Children of Yidhra.

possible_blessings.name: Linked
possible_blessings.description: Mental/physical link to the avatar they follow.

possible_blessings.name: Illusions
possible_blessings.description: Ability to fashion temporary illusions.

possible_blessings.name: Immortality
possible_blessings.description: Merging with Yidhra to be reborn. Insane, immortal, possessing fangs and hunger.

deity_entry.encounters: Begins with those touched by the entity/cultists. Tokens found around the world. Entity is active now.
deity_entry.aura: Differing aspects offer divergent auras. Human forms use fear, power, sexuality. Monstrous forms use fear.

magic.spells: Barrier of Pain, Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Bind Enemy, Blight/Bless Crop, Call Lightning, Cause Disease, Command Shoggoth, Curse, Deflect Harm, Dominate, Enthrall Victim, Levitate, Shrivelling, Siren's Song; others.

powers.name: Absorption
powers.description: Consumes living creatures to gain memories/evolutionary distinctiveness. Can rebirth matter as lurkers.

powers.name: Division and Change
powers.description: Can reform/shape itself in unlimited ways.

physical_manifestation.title: Typical Physical Manifestation: Yidhra's True Form

combat.description: Revolting mass of protoplasm. Strikes with pseudopods/limbs/mouths.

special_maneuvers.name: Consume
special_maneuvers.description: Absorbs target over 1D4 rounds. Escape with Extreme STR/DEX. 1D8 damage + 10 CON/APP loss if escaped. Absorbed = death.

special_maneuvers.name: Roll
special_maneuvers.description: Crushing damage 6D6.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. Regenerates 3 HP per 1 MP. If 0 HP, dissolves and cannot reform in true form.

deity_entry.name: Yig
deity_entry.description_quote: As an ancient serpent, you shall know Yig. Of scaled flesh, ophidian eyes and face, on a coiled tail or on two legs does Yig walk upon a bed of snakes. With two arms does Yig grasp this world, claiming dominion and ownership.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: From between the stars came Yig to settle on this planet... Yig's connection to this planet appears to remain intact and strong, with the entity freely able to manifest... Recovered annals of the serpent people speak of Yig at first dwelling in Yoth or K'n-yan, but later moving to some secret place named Y'dethal... Yig is sometimes recorded as acting in a fashion that some would call benevolent toward humanity, encouraging and rewarding those humans who offer their worship and also to those who protect snakes from harm... It is clear that those who work against Yig's will and those who would harm a snake may find the Curse of Yig on their heads.

cult.text: Worshiped by serpent people and some humans. K'n-yanians also venerated Yig. Human cults often seek Yig's favor for protection or power over snakes.

possible_blessings.name: Snake Control
possible_blessings.description: Ability to command snakes.

deity_entry.encounters: Deep wilderness, deserts, ancient ruins. Presence heralded by mass of snakes.
deity_entry.aura: Ancient, reptilian, cold. A sense of the primal earth.

magic.spells: Alter Weather, Blight/Bless Crop, Contact Chthonian, Deflect Harm, Dominate, Enthrall Victim, Send Dream, Sense Life, Wrack; others.

powers.name: Command Snakes
powers.description: Calls/commands snakes to infest area. Includes Children of Yig.

powers.name: Curse of Yig
powers.description: Transmutation into snake-monster (Extreme POW to avoid) or bloodline curse causing serpentine progeny.

combat.description: Strikes with claws/tail/bite or grabs.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab and Grasp
special_maneuvers.description: Holds target firm. Next round crush (2D6) or bite (1D8+venom). Escape with Extreme STR/DEX.

special_maneuvers.name: Venom
special_maneuvers.description: Extreme CON or die instantly. Success = 1D8 damage + delirium.

armor.notes: Critical hit ignores armor. Melee weapons break if Luck fail (corrosive blood). Regenerates 2 HP per 1 MP. If 0 HP, transforms into snake and flees. Reforms in 4D100 days.

deity_entry.name: Yog-Sothoth
deity_entry.description_quote: From without it shall come, a frothing conglomeration of spheres of unearthly hue, each joined by threads of rippling and protoplasmic flesh... Ever-expanding and contracting, filling the sky.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: An immense entity dwelling in the interstices between dimensions... Coterminous with all space and time... Yog-Sothoth appears more like connective tissue in which the knowledge of existence dwells... In certain texts, the entity is said to be 'locked' outside of our universe... Those of sorcerous pursuits are believed to consider Yog-Sothoth as a giver of divine wisdom... It is thought, that by joining with human flesh, Yog-Sothoth shall enjoy a permanency in this realm... Yog-Sothoth knows the gate. Yog-Sothoth is the gate. Yog-Sothoth is the key and guardian of the gate.

cult.text: Few large-scale cults. Recognized by many cults. Wizards seek commune. Cults include Followers of Yet, Convocation of Time, All-Seeing Ones, Whateley clan.

possible_blessings.name: All Knowing
possible_blessings.description: Inform cultists of future events (bonus die).

possible_blessings.name: Cosmic Knowledge
possible_blessings.description: Bestows +1D10 Cthulhu Mythos and equal Sanity loss per round of witnessing. Risk of turning to Mythos.

possible_blessings.name: Resurrection
possible_blessings.description: Eternal life via Resurrection spell.

possible_blessings.name: Travel
possible_blessings.description: Allow travel to other places/times (Gate spell).

deity_entry.encounters: Direct encounters rare. Manifestations often disastrous. Cultists magically well-armed.
deity_entry.aura: Terrifying, alien, iridescent. Sensory assault.

magic.spells: Augury, Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Chasm to Hell, Curse of the Rat-Thing, Dread Curse of Azathoth, Fist of Yog-Sothoth, Wrack; knows all spells.

powers.name: Knowledge
powers.description: See Blessings. Can bestow any spell.

powers.name: Monsters on Call
powers.description: Summon one monster per round (various).

powers.name: Travel
powers.description: Enable person to travel anywhere/when. May appear anywhere.

combat.description: Summon monsters, travel powers, spells, or Spheres/Bolts.

special_maneuvers.name: Bolts
special_maneuvers.description: 5 MP/bolt. Up to 5/round. 500 yards range. Destroys objects. 5D10 damage to person (reduced to essential salts if killed).

special_maneuvers.name: Spheres
special_maneuvers.description: Slimy sphere touches target (20 yards). Permanent loss 3D10 CON + 2D10 APP. Reduced to essential salts if CON 0.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. If 0 HP, departs. Undying.

deity_entry.name: Yog-Sothoth: Aforgomon
deity_entry.description_quote: As like a ray or beam of crackling energy does Aforgomon appear, reaching from the angles of time to penetrate the barriers of our world.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: A strange and rarely encountered avatar of Yog-Sothoth, Aforgomon appears to be concerned with time rather than space... appears only to those who have angered Yog-Sothoth by meddling with time... Aforgomon may be a personification of the Outer God's retribution... An opposing view sees Aforgomon as Yog-Sothoth's veins, that run through and connect differing dimensions of time.

cult.text: Little organized worship on Earth. Inhabitants of other dimensions pay devotion. Witches/wizards call upon it to change past/divine future.

possible_blessings.name: Perceive Time
possible_blessings.description: Glimpses of past/future.

possible_blessings.name: Time Travel
possible_blessings.description: Limited travel (1 MP per month moved).

deity_entry.encounters: Caught in or meddling with time (Time Gate spell).
deity_entry.aura: Ever-changing quality of time. Environment rapidly alters.

magic.spells: Augury, Bestow Glimpse of Truth, Fist of Yog-Sothoth; others.

powers.name: Chain of Aforgomon
powers.description: Transports victim to Dreamlands, chained to chair over abyss. Chains heat to incandescence. Permanent madness/death.

powers.name: Manipulate Time
powers.description: Halt/manipulate time within 10 miles.

powers.name: Time Travel
powers.description: Pass in/out of time at will.

combat.description: Uses powers or bolt of fire.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons (50% chance they disintegrate). Undying.

deity_entry.name: Yog-Sothoth: Tawil at'Umr
deity_entry.description_quote: A figure cloaked in shimmering, almost kaleidoscopic, fabrics that seemed to shift and change in the light. Where a head should be, a sphere of iridescence glowed...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: This avatar... appears to be a more benign aspect... often acting as a guide to the Gates of the Silver Key... It is said Tawil at'Umr rewards those who show it respect... It has been known to grant longevity and travel to other dimensions.

cult.text: Worshipped by sorcerers seeking the Ultimate Gate. Cults are small, secretive.

possible_blessings.name: Prolong Life
possible_blessings.description: Halt aging.

possible_blessings.name: Gate
possible_blessings.description: Knowledge of Gate spells.

deity_entry.encounters: Summoned by ritual or found guarding the Ultimate Gate.
deity_entry.aura: Sense of immense age and wisdom. Peacefulness masking infinite power.

magic.spells: Gate, Contact/Summon Yog-Sothoth; others.

powers.name: Telepathy
powers.description: Communicates mentally.

powers.name: All Knowing
powers.description: Imparts info (past/present/future). May ask for offering.

powers.name: Gateway
powers.description: Opens doorway to show scenes or allow travel.

combat.description: Does not usually fight. Touch sends victim to another dimension.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons. If 0 HP, fades away.

deity_entry.name: Zathog
deity_entry.description_quote: A bubbling mass of ever-churning protoplasm, dripping slime and sprouting vestigial limbs... Demented eyes form and then burst... holes appear that take mouth-like shapes...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Little written concerning Zathog... Necronomicon suggests a large and amorphous entity, not unlike a greater cousin of the earthly shoggoths... Dwell within the core of Zarr, a planet in another galaxy... Zathog fled from the Elder Ones... Most convincing theory places Old One as a twin being to Ubbo-Sathla...

cult.text: Exclusively worshipped by inhabitants of Zarr (including Zarrian Robots). Human cults do not exist or are rare.

deity_entry.encounters: Rare unless summoned (Prayer to Zathog). Zarrians may come to Earth.
deity_entry.aura: Alien lair filled with exotic lifeforms.

magic.spells: None.

powers.name: Brood of Zathog
powers.description: Produces 1D6 offspring per round.

powers.name: Leech Touch
powers.description: Absorbs 1D4 MP and 1D4 HP per round.

powers.name: Intelligent
powers.description: Capable of communication.

combat.description: Lashes/grabs. Strike damage random 1D4 to 14D6.

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Held (1D4 damage). Next round squeeze (7D6) or absorb (14D6). Escape with Extreme STR or Hard DEX.

armor.notes: Impaling weapons min damage. Regenerates 20 HP/round. If 0 HP, drains away. Reforms in 3D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Zhar & Lloigor
deity_entry.description_quote: Zhar as like a great number of eels, bound together, upright, and ever-moving in unison, while Lloigor resembled a mound of writhing worms. Separate, yet connected in body by strands...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Seemingly conjoined pairs of entities... thought to have once been separate beings... Current dwelling place is unclear, although most cite the mysterious Plateau of Sung... Zhar and Lloigor reside within a great body of water... Tcho-tcho peoples said to have been cursed by their association.

cult.text: Tcho-tcho who remained close to Plateau worship them. Cult of the Twins. Bound Ones (Pacific West).

possible_blessings.name: Joined
possible_blessings.description: Bind pairs of humans together (mentally/physically).

deity_entry.encounters: Cultists working in pairs. Recruitment of twins.
deity_entry.aura: Strange pulling sensation compelling movement toward them.

magic.spells: Clutch of Nyogtha, Contact Human (variant), Summon/Bind Byakhee, Contact Lloigor, Dominate; others.

powers.name: Compulsion
powers.description: Compels those within 300 yards to move toward them (POW roll). Within 50 yards, Hard POW or throw self into mass.

powers.name: Melding
powers.description: Prolonged contact causes melding into their flesh.

powers.name: Mental Contact
powers.description: Telepathic transmissions.

powers.name: Sinuous
powers.description: Supple and malleable bodies.

combat.description: Uses tentacles to strike/grab or mass to crush.

special_maneuvers.name: Crush
special_maneuvers.description: Envelopes and crushes (5D6 damage).

special_maneuvers.name: Grab
special_maneuvers.description: Held. Melding causes 1D6 damage + 10 CON loss/round. Escape Extreme STR/DEX (ripping skin).

armor.notes: If 0 HP, dissolves. Reforms in 4D100 years.

deity_entry.name: Zoth-Ommog
deity_entry.description_quote: It possessed a cone-shaped body that tapered to a flat, tail-like end... on land it used four great tentacular arms... to drag itself about... Head... a blunted triangular mass surrounded by a mane of coiling tentacles... Inset were two, possibly four, serpentine eyes...
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Zoth-Ommog is believed to have been spawned by Great Cthulhu... Common to all is the belief that Zoth-Ommog dwells in the deep oceans... but whether it is bound within... R'lyeh or free to roam is uncertain. While primarily sea-based, Zoth-Ommog appears able to transport itself on land while also capable of levitation or flight... Stories from the Pacific Ocean regarding monstrous deep-sea dwellers... may have some currency as evidence of partial sightings.

cult.text: Cult of Cthulhu holds Zoth-Ommog within their thoughts... Some sub-sects... have become solely focused on Zoth-Ommog... Deep one communities offer sacrifices.

possible_blessings.name: Gills
possible_blessings.description: Gills to breathe underwater.

possible_blessings.name: Tentacles
possible_blessings.description: Limbs transformed into tentacles.

deity_entry.encounters: Seafaring folk. Divers. Deep one hybrids. Cthulhu Cult.
deity_entry.aura: Idols feel cold and cause sensation of sinking/drowning. Presence brings deep loathing. Constant humming sound causes delusions.

magic.spells: Any dealing with Cthulhu, Ythogtha, Dagon, Hydra, Deep Ones, Star-Spawn.

powers.name: Vibrating Hum
powers.description: Emits constant hum causing delusions/hallucinations (Sanity loss).

combat.description: Swipe/strike with tentacles or ram/tail smash.

special_maneuvers.name: Ram
special_maneuvers.description: Targets group (within 2 yards). 5D6 damage.

special_maneuvers.name: Tail
special_maneuvers.description: Targets group (within 5 yards). 3D6 damage.

armor.notes: Regenerates 3 HP per 1 MP. If 0 HP, disintegrates. Reforms in 4D10 years.

deity_entry.name: Zu-Che-Quon
deity_entry.description_quote: There was no light, just a cloying darkness enveloping everything... As the earth stirred beneath our feet and the temperature dropped, the darkness congregated and amassed into a swirling vortex.
deity_entry.main_entry_text: Believed to inhabit the dark void of space beyond the Omega Nebula... Summoned to Earth but few times... Book of Iod presents Zu-che-quon as initially the offspring but later as the progenitor of Cyegha... Worshiped in prehistorical Mu by a small sect, known as the Smothering Hand... Appears not to have been imprisoned... but rather brought to a state of continual torpor... Presence of Zu-che-quon is anathema to earthly life.

cult.text: Few humans worship. Cults are disparate. Smothering Hand (Virginia and Germany). Eyeless Ones (Utah). Opposed by Cthugha worshippers.

possible_blessings.name: Eyeless
possible_blessings.description: Pluck out own eyes for enhanced sensory faculties.

possible_blessings.name: Dark Form
possible_blessings.description: Transform into incorporeal dark cloud (3 MP/round).

deity_entry.encounters: Cultist activity (kidnapping, blinding).
deity_entry.aura: All light smothered. Temperature drop. Earth tremors. Darkness feels sticky and tangible. Sound of flapping.

magic.spells: Clutch of Nyogtha, Fist of Yog-Sothoth, Mindblast, Possession (variant), Power Drain; others.

powers.name: Summons
powers.description: Requires discordant bells. Manifests only if sound continues.

powers.name: Enveloping Darkness
powers.description: All light sources go out. Thick darkness. Penalty die to skills. Tremors (DEX roll).

powers.name: Un-seeable
powers.description: Presence causes painful eye discomfort. Humans must make CON roll or scratch eyes (1D4 damage on fumble). Indefinite insanity causes self-blinding.

combat.description: Nebulous/semi-corporeal. Does not use physical attacks. Uses spells/powers.

armor.notes: Immune to mundane weapons, fire, electricity, chemical. Spells/Mythos powers may harm/dispel. If 0 HP, vanishes to space. Unable to manifest for 4D100+100 years.
